Rawan is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes.

loans.name: Cándida Paula

texts.es:
La joven Cándida paula, actualmente labora en un centro de educativo, cuenta con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad, es  soltera con espíritu de superación, actualmente se presentó a Ceprodel, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la mejora de su vivienda ya que es de su conocimiento que Ceprodel apoya a este tipo de actividad. 

Por esta razón,  se presentó para solicitar un crédito para la compra de: Ladrillo y Cemento para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que esto le permitirá vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia, donde para él es de gran importancia el crédito porque ayuda al desarrollo familiar
texts.en:
Cándida currently works at an educational center.  She has one child for whom she is responsible.  She is single, and she has the spirit for improvement.

She came to Ceprodel in order to request a loan to make improvements to her house.   She knows that Ceprodel supports this type of activity.  That is the reason that she went to request a loan to buy bricks and cement to improve her home.  This will allow her to live with her family under better conditions.  

The loan is of great importance to her because it helps with the family development.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement.

loans.name: Jesus Es Prosperidad 1 Group

texts.en:
Maribel is the coordinator of her group, Jesus Es Prosperidad 1 (Jesus Is Prosperity). This group is located in Santiago, an area known for tobacco and beef production. Santiago is the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. The group members are dedicated to selling clothes, food, shoes and jewelry.

Maribel lives in a simple structure with her three children and her husband, who is also her children's father. 

Maribel is excited about her sixth loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for approximately two years, starting with her first loan from Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing more clothes. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business. 

She will use the profits to save, because she wants to make one of her dreams come true: to have a clothing store. Maribel thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 42-year-old conservative woman; she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.  

Iman has five sons and daughters. Her husband has owned a mini-market for almost eight months now.  Iman want to support her husband, so she has applied for this loan in order to bring in more food products to the store to have variety and attract more customers.

loans.use: to bring in more food products to the store

loans.name: Mirian Andrea

texts.es: Mirian nació en Valencia que pertenece a la provincia de Quevedo. Como es madre soltera se traslado a vivir a Buena Fe. Tiene 35 años es bachiller y tiene un hijo. Nos cuenta que desde muy joven aprendió a ser responsable por ser madre y padre, ahora su hijo tiene 15 años y está en el colegio. Su tienda la empezó poco a poco al ver resultados fue incrementando el negocio con víveres ya que por el sector donde vive no hay muchas tiendas. Su hermana vive con ella y le ayuda en el negocio porque ella realizar labores domésticos desde las 8 am hasta las 4 pm que sale, luego de eso ella se ocupa del negocio hasta que lo cierra en la noche. Mirian no ha tenido mayores problemas por su barrio porque es conocida pero eso no quiere decir que no haya delincuencia en su sector. Con el préstamo va a comprar víveres, pollos y adecuar con perchas su tienda. A Mirian le gustaría en los próximos años abrir un restaurant, continuar con la tienda y ayudar a su hijo en la universidad.
texts.en:
Mirian was born in Valencia in the province of Quevedo.  Because she's a single mother, she moved to Buena Fe.  She's thirty-five, a high-school graduate, and has one child.  She tells us that she learned from when she was very young to be responsible in the role of mother and father.  Now her son is fifteen and in high school.  

Little by little, Mirian's store began to see results.  She grew the business with merchandise because there aren't many stores in her area.  Her sister lives with her and helps out in the business because Mirian goes out to work as a maid from 8AM to 4PM, and then works in the store until it closes at night.  Mirian has not had major problems in her neighborhood because she's well-known, but that's not to say there isn't any crime.

Mirian plans to use her loan to buy merchandise, chickens, and to put in some shelves.  In the next few years, she would like to open a restaurant, continue with the store, and help her child with college.

loans.use: to buy supplies, chickens, and shelving.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a 31-year-old single lady; she has a younger brother and sister.  

Suha used to work in a clothing store, but the store had to be closed down. After that she decided to use her experience and went to the free zone area in Aqaba southern Jordan and buy a collection of clothes to sell at a higher price in her town.  

She has applied for this loan to buy more and new spring collection for all ages so she would have variety in the clothes she sells.

loans.use: to expand her inventory with a new spring collection

loans.name: Ghena

texts.en:
Applying for the first loan has helped her in attracting more people to her home food store, it added more variety to the products she used to sell.  Using the increased revenues she was able to build a new room and moved the food store from her house into it.  She also started selling more food items  than just snacks and candy.  

Now Ghena has applied again for a loan to improve the interior decoration of the store and bring in more food products.

loans.use: to improve her store's interior decoration and bring in more food products

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Marites has a shop that sells tablea or home made chocolate. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making home made chocolate bars.
Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making tablea or home made chocolate

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha is 31 years old. She is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than five years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 per day. Her children are still in her care and in school. In order to improve her husband’s business, Chantha is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his work. This purchase would enable her husband run his business smoothly. In the future, she would like to run a groceries store to earn extra income to support the family and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new timber house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks,soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 45-year-old housewife who is married to a driver.  They have three daughters and a son.  

Mona wanted to help in improving her family's living conditions, so she started to sell clothes and blankets at her house.  Now that she has regular customers Mona wants to add more variety to her products.  She has applied for this loan in order to start selling lighter bed covers that are suitable for summer season.

loans.use: to add lighter bed covers to her inventory

loans.name: Rinal

texts.en:
Rinal is a 30-year-old married lady; she has two boys.  Her husband owns a supermarket.  

Rinal took few fitness courses and got a certificate to be a fitness coach, then she bought a few machines and some equipment and used her house's second floor as a gymnastics area.  

She has applied for this loan in order to buy more fitness machines so that she can make enough revenue to help her open a bigger fitness club with a spa section.

loans.use: to buy more fitness machines

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is married with 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juvy is 47 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

Juvy has a fishing business in the Philippines. Juvy requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing materials.

Juvy has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Juvy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Mary Grace has a shop that sells RTW's like t-shirts, jackets, pants and short pants. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of RTW's to sell like blouses, jackets and pants. Mary Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear garments like pants, jackets and t-shirts

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en: Sokly is 49 years old. She is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling desserts for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, who earns about $3 per day. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $10 per day. Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Sokly is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Andres Avelino Caceres Group

texts.en:
"Andres Avelino Caceres" is a village bank, which consists of twelve entrepreneurial women and men who live and work in Cusco. The members dedicate themselves to a variety of activities here in the southern Andean mountains of Peru. Some of them raise small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. Others buy and sell artisanal goods, and one of the women has a business selling "chicha", a Peruvian fermented corn beverage.

One of the members, Alejandrina, is pictured wearing a pink sweater on the right side of the photo. She is 59 years old and a widow with seven children who are all fully grown and living independently. Alejandrina supports herself by selling candy in front of a school and running a small grocery store in her house. Alejandrina is requesting 1,000 Peru Nuevo Soles (PEN) from the group loan in order to purchase more candy and stock up her store with products such as beer, soda, sugar, and other products of basic necessity. She says that she looks forward to growing her business a little during this loan cycle, by increasing her merchandise and attracting more customers.

loans.use: to buy candy, beer, soda, sugar, and other products of basic necessity.

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar is a 29-year-old, married guy who has one son and lives with his family in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia that lacks basic infrastructure. He is an engineer. His spouse works as a manager and his son stays at his mother-in-law’s house. 

Ulambayar’s current house changes temperature very quickly and is so old, so he needs some renovation work. Thus, Ulambayar is requesting a 3,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase needed construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maria Helen

texts.en:
Maria Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Maria Helen has been in this business for 28 years now. She requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

In the future, Maria Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Paz

texts.en:
Ma. Paz is 51 years old and married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Paz has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. Ma. Paz requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

In the future, Ma. Paz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Mamadrajab

texts.ru: Мамадрачаб житель района Яван. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама он занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Мамадрачаб разводит мелко - рогатый и крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа быка, коровы и бычков.
texts.en: Mamadrajab resides in the Yavan region. He is 38 years old, married, and has four children. Mamadrajab's wife works at an orchard, while he raises livestock at home. Mamadrajab has spent the past 7 years raising cattle, goats, and sheep. He is taking this loan to purchase a bull, a cow, and a few calves.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Kulpunai

texts.ru: Кулпунай – лидер группы «Ак-жолтой», объединяющей еще 3 участников. Кулпунай 35 лет, замужем,  имеет 3 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, Кулпунай занимается животноводством и полеводством.  На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 6 голов коров и 0,16 га земельного надела, где она выращивает картофель и кукурузу . В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулпунай обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Кулпунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Kulpunai is the leader of the Ak-Joltoy group, which contains 3 other members. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. To provide a source of income for her family, Kulpunai raises cattle and cultivates crops. Presently, her farm has 6 cows and 0.16 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and corn. In order to continue developing her business, Kulpunai has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy more cattle. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 44 years old and married with 6 children. She earns a living farming rice in the Philippines. Luzviminda has been farming rice for 18 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Luzviminda is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en: Mateo is 42-year-old married man. He has 2 grown children. They live in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Mateo has been a fisherman for 8 years. He makes a monthly income of 3,000 PHP from fishing. In 2007, Mateo joined GDMPC. He has applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP in order to repair fishing materials so that he can continue fishing. Mateo hopes to earn more income and improve his living condition.

loans.use: to repair fishing materials.

loans.name: Gulzamon

texts.ru: Гулзамон на сегодняшний день занимается торговлей. Она открыла продуктовый магазин. Кроме того она занимается животноводством. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Currently, Gulzamon is a merchant and runs her own grocery store. She also continues to raise livestock. She is taking this loan to stock up on food products and thereby increase the volume of her sales.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis  es un hombre  que tiene  43 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con tres hijos a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Luis  vive  en el  caserío Los Laureles del distrito de Cayalti, departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este distrito viven todas las  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Luis es al transporte público de mototaxi el recorrido lo realiza entre las zonas de Los Laureles  – Cayalti  y visciversa. Además se dedica a ofrecer servicios en tienda de agroquímicos en sus tiempos libres,  generándole otros ingresos para cubrir gastos propios; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  de transporte público Luis cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. 
Actualmente  Luis esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 1000 nuevos soles que será para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo (cambio de neumáticos, sistema de arrastre y cambio de aceite),  esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a forty-three-year-old man who has a common law wife and three kids in his care.  He lives with his partner and kids in their own house.  He says that the standard of living in his community is subsistence, and most people work independently in business, farming, and livestock.  Luis lives in the hamlet of Los Laureles, Cayalti District in the department of Lambayeque.  He also has basic electrical service, and says that all the families in the district live under these conditions.  

Luis's works in motor taxi public transportation; his routes go back and forth among zones in Los Laureles and other zones in Cayalti.  In his free time, he also offers agrochemical services to make more money to cover expenses.   He notes that he has five years of experience in public transportation, which have allowed him to maintain an established clientele.  

Luis is currently seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 soles, which he plans to use to maintain his vehicle (change the oil, tires, and suspension system); it's a very profitable business in his area and in time it's going to allow him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his motor taxi.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana tiene 22 años, es una mujer soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres con sus hermanos menores. Su casa se ubica en el distrito de San Ramón- Chanchamayo.


Se dedica al servicio de cabinas de Internet, para ello cuenta con 6 computadoras que alquila por horas. Además, compró una fotocopiadora con la que realiza trabajos para estudiantes de todas las edades. “La ventaja es que mi negocio es en el centro de la ciudad, por eso los clientes nunca faltan”, menciona. Y como ella no se conforma, también se dedicará a la agricultura, ya que sus padres le otorgaron una parcela. Ella y su hermano sembrarán un poco de café y plátanos. 
De esa manera ahorrará el dinero suficiente para estudiar una carrera universitaria, que es una de sus metas más próximas.

Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” y se siente cómoda de formar parte de un grupo de personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el dinero solicitado podrá realizar el mantenimiento de sus computadoras, y lo restante será para adquirir bolsas de abono para su nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Diana is 22 years old, a single mother, and lives in her parents house with her younger brothers. The house is located in the district of San Roman-Chanchamayo. Diana's business has internet cubicles; she has 6 computers for rent by the hour. In addition, she purchased a photocopier and now makes copies for students of all ages. “An advantage is that my business is in the center of the city and, for this reason, there is never a shortage of customers,” she mentions. And, as Diana reported, she also farms; her parents have provided a parcel of land. Diana and her brother have planted a little coffee and plantains. In this way, she has saved sufficient money to study a career at the university, which is one of her proximate goals.

This will be her 1st loan through MFP. Diana gives her word that she will be punctual in her monthly payments. She belongs to “Las Triunfadoras” [The Triumphant Ones] communal bank, and she feels comfortable at forming a part of a group of responsible and supportive people.

With the solicited funds, Diana will carry out maintenance on her computers; the remainder will be used to acquire sacks of manure for her new plantings.

loans.use: maintain the computers in her internet cafe and buy manure for her crops.

loans.name: Mitze

texts.en:
Mitze is 44 years old and married with one child.

Mitze works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Mitze has borrowed and repaid thirteen loans from NWTF previously. She has been running her grocery store for 30 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Mitze aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Paquita

texts.en:
Paquita is 62 years old, married, and has five children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.  She also earns income from food and vegetable selling.  

Paquita is requesting her twentieth loan through NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stock to sell.  Paquita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is widowed and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Rosie runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years.  She sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, soap, and soft drinks.

Rosie is requesting a loan for 23,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more stock to sell.  In the future Rosie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio de 64 años de edad, soltero con un hijo de 12 años de edad, vive en una aldea del municipio de Arizona, Tela, Atlántida.
Don Antonio es un señor muy trabajador se gana la vida elaborando y vendiendo tajadas de plátano en bolsa en forma de ristras. Ya tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, anteriormente se dedicaba solo a la agricultura y por necesidad de obtener mayores ingresos para la manutención de su hijo pudo establecer su propio negocio.
Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo para comprar más insumos para elaborar las tajadas que vende en bolsitas en forma de ristra, este producto tiene buena demanda, con el préstamo anterior logro incrementar las ventas y ahora espera crecer mas. Su meta es continuar creciendo en el negocio para obtener los ingresos que le ayuden a darle una buena educación a su hijo y hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Antonio, age 64, is single and has a 12 year old son.  He lives in a village in the Arizona municipality in Tela, Atlántida.

Antonio is a very hard-working man who earns a living making and selling fried banana slices.  He sells them in bunches that are packaged in bags.  He has been doing this business activity for two years.  He used to work only in agriculture.  However, out of the necessity of earning greater income to support his son, he was able to establish his own business.

He is requesting a second loan to buy more supplies to make the fried banana slices that he sells in bunches that are packaged in bags.  There is a good demand for this product.  With his previous loan he managed to increase his sales, and he now hopes they grow even more.

His goal is to continue growing in the business in order to get the income that will help him give his son a good education and to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy supplies like oil, bags, and bananas to make fried banana slices and sell them in bunches.

loans.name: Antonia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Antonia del Socorro actualmente desempeña el cargo de Maestra en un centro educativo. Es una joven soltera con dos hijo bajo su cargo, donde esto la ha motivado a seguir luchando, se le presento la oportunidad de conocer que  Ceprodel por primera vez y se dio cuenta que apoyaba a las personas con créditos para su desarrollo. 

Por esta razón,  se presentó para solicitar un crédito para la compra de Cemento, Arena y Pago de Mano de Obra, estando consciente que logrará obtener mejores condiciones de vida en su familia y saldrá adelante esto la motiva a seguir luchando en sus labores que enfrenta día a día.
texts.en:
Antonia del Socorro currently works as a schoolteacher.  She’s a single young lady with two children whom she cares for and this motivates her to forge ahead.  She learned about Ceprodel for the first time and learned that they provide loans for personal development.

She decided to apply for a loan in order to buy cement, sand, and pay for labor so that she can provide better living conditions for her family.  This motivates her to move ahead in her daily work.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Marìa Vilma

texts.es:
María  es una mujer que tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, con un hijo a su cargo,  vive con su cónyuge  en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. María vive  en el  caserío Annape del distrito de Mòrrope, departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica  y el consumo de agua lo realizan a través de un pozo artezanal; también se menciona que en este distrito viven todas las  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica María es a la compra y venta de verduras; lo cual vende en un puesto del mercado de Mòrrope, donde le va muy bien en este negocio. Además se dedica a la crianza y engorde de ganado caprino y aves de corral,  generándole otros ingresos para cubrir gastos propios; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  de comercialización María  cuenta con 2 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio .Así mismo su cónyuge también le apoya en este negocio. 
Actualmente  María esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 2000 nuevos soles que será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de verduras)  y realizar arreglo de sus corrales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
María is a 27-year-old single woman with one dependent child and lives with her partner in her own house.  She mentions that the quality of life in the community is of subsistence; the majority of the inhabitants are independent workers that make a living through commerce, agriculture, and livestock.  María lives in the hamlet of Annape in the district of Mórrope, department of Lambayeque; it has basic electricity service and gets water through an artesian well.  She says that all the families in this district live under these conditions.  

The work through which María makes a living is the purchase and sale of vegetables, which she sells in a stall in the market of Mórrope, where she is doing well with the business.  She also makes a living raising and fattening up goats and poultry, generating more income to cover her own costs.  It is worth noting that María has had two years of experience in this work, which has allowed her to keep her already established customers in this business.  Likewise, her partner also supports her in this work.

Now, María is asking for a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa for an amount of 2000 nuevos soles that will be used for working capital (to buy vegetables) and to arrange her pens. This is because it is a very profitable activity in the area, and which in time will allow her to go on improving her standard of living with her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to stock up her business.

loans.name: Sophors

texts.en:
Sophors is 36 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. Her mother lives with the family.  She lives in Kampot Province, Cambodia. Sophors has been involved in the agricultural business for more than 20 years with extensive experience. She grows rice and fattens up cattle. She also sells sugarcane juice to earn additional income to support the family. She earns about $3 per day. Her husband is a policeman who earns about $4 per day. 

Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Sophors is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, Sophors would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery. Elma has been in this business for 25 years. Elma earns more income from raising chickens. Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Noël

texts.fr: Noël est âgé de 40 ans et vit au Benin. Noël n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Noël est marié à une marchande du nom de Antoinette. Le couple a six enfants à leur charge dont cinq constituent leurs propres enfants. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Noël vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Noël mène comme activité la menuiserie dans sa région depuis seize ans. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de nourrir sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Noël s’approvisionne en madriers dans une ville du Benin. Dans la quête de la meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’améliorer son activité, Noël sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Noël is 40 years old and he lives in Benin. He never went to school. He is married to a merchant named Antoinette, and the couple have six dependent children, five of them being their own. Some of the children attend school. Noël lives with his wife and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Noël has been working locally as a carpenter for the past 16 years. This activity allows him to support himself and feed his family. He buys his lumber in a city of Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction and bolster his business, Noël is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. Past loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy lumber, glue and varnish.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Tita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Tita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack foods, milk, canned goods, etc. In the future Tita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 47 years old, married, and has three children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Virginia has been raising livestock for 13 years and also earns additional income from selling food. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Martha Julia

texts.es: Martha es una mujer de 37 años, madre soltera de 2 niños. Vive en Ventanas cantón de Quevedo. Su casa es propia y sus hijos asisten a la escuela. Hace 5 años empezó el negocio de venta de frutas y víveres, no se queja le va muy bien y gracias a eso puede mantener a su familia. Martha nos cuenta que si es un poco cansado ya que su día empieza a las 6 de la mañana  comprando las frutas, como son productos de corta duración la compra es diaria. Por ahora no tiene ninguna dificultad en su entorno ya que es conocida. El crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de frutas y víveres también ampliando su inventario con arroz, azúcar etc. Su meta próxima que espera realizar es aumentar su negocio para brindar una mejor forma de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha is a 37 year old single mother of two children living in Ventanas, Quevedo Canton.  Her house is her own and her children attend school.  

Five years ago she started selling fruit and groceries.  She can’t complain because she does very well and thanks to it is able to support her family.  Martha tells us that it is a bit tiring though because her day starts at 6am buying fruit because since they are a product with a short shelf life, she has to buy them every day.  For now, she does not have any particular difficulty in her surroundings since she’s well-known.  

She will use the loan to buy fruit and groceries expanding her inventory with rice, sugar, etc.  Her next goal she expects to reach is to increase business to provide a better way of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy fruit and groceries.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 46 years old and married with one child.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of goods to sell.

Alma has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from vending vegetables.

Alma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of goods to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and widowed with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a food production business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel works hard to support her family. Rechel is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years now.

Rechel requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials.

In the future, Rechel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 61 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Nenita is borrowing 15000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nenita has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats). She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
Camila tiene 29 años, es una madre soltera de 2 hijos de 14 y 7 años. Juntos viven en la casa de sus familiares, ubicada en el distrito de San Ramón- Chanchamayo.

Ella es una mujer de coraje y de carácter fuerte. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, perfumes y ropa por catálogo. “Ya son casi 3 años que me dedico a esto y no me puedo quejar, sí es rentable”, dice. Este negocio le abrió muchas puertas por el contacto con personas que se hicieron sus amigos con el tiempo y le ofrecieron trabajar con ella en negocios eventuales como la venta de celulares. Pero menciona que le va mucho mejor con los cosméticos. Ahora ya es promotora de ventas de varias marcas y recibe regalos cada vez que capta clientes. Una de sus metas es construir su propia casa y brindarles a sus hijos un poco de privacidad.

Ésta es la primera vez que Camila solicita un crédito a MFP, por eso se compromete en ser responsable en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, y se siente a gusto con sus compañeros porque son solidarios y trabajadores.
Con el dinero que solicita podrá comprar la mercadería para la temporada del día de la madre para cumplir con los pedidos que le hicieron hasta el momento.
texts.en:
Camila is 29 years old.  She is a single mother and has two children who are 14 and 7 years old.  They live together in her relatives' house which is located in San Ramón district, Chanchamayo.

Camila is a brave woman with a strong character.  Her business is selling cosmetics, perfume and clothing through catalogs.  "I have been in this business for almost three years and I can't complain.  It is profitable", she says.  This business opened many doors to Camila because she had contact with people who, over time, became friends and offered to work with her in other potential businesses such as selling cell phones.  However, she says that her cosmetics business does much better.  She is now a sales promoter for several brands and receives gifts each time she gains customers.  One of her goals is to build her own home and provide her children with a little privacy.

This is the first time that Camila has requested a loan from MFP and she pledges to be responsible in making her monthly repayments.  She is a member of 'Las Triunfadoras' community bank and feels happy with her fellow group members because they are supportive and hard working people.

Camila will use the money that she has requested to buy merchandise for the period leading up to Mothers Day.  This will allow her to fill orders that people have made with her.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Corazon works hard to support her family. She has a photocopier business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an internet cafe and selling water. Corazon is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her photocopier business, like paper, toner, etc.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her photocopy business, like paper, toner, etc.

loans.name: Medilyn

texts.en:
Medilyn is 36 years old and married with four children. Medilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a firewood retail business in the Philippines and has requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional firewood to sell.

Medilyn has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the firewood retail for two years and also earns income from a general store.

Medilyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 34 years old and married with three children.

Rebecca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 19000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Rebecca has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig-fattening and electronic re-loading.

Rebecca aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is 35 years old and married with four children who are in school. Bebelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Bebelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, sardines, eggs, noodles, etc.

In the future, Bebelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria  es una mujer que tiene 55  años de edad, de estado civil casada, con dos  hijos,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus hijos. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Gloria vive en  el caserío Federico Villareal  del distrito de Túcume del  departamento de  Lambayeque, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, posta médica, colegio, iglesia;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Gloria es la crianza/venta de ganado porcino , ovinos  y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Gloria cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella  vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  1.5  has de cultivo de arroz o cual presenta buen estado fenològico y donde  le permite tener otro ingresos. 
Actualmente  Gloria se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.1,000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceado y arreglo de corrales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria, 55, is a married woman with two children.  She lives in her own house with her spouse can children.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life of the community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers in commerce and animal husbandry and some of them also work in agriculture.  

Gloria lives in the Federico Villareal settlement in Túcume District, Lambayeque Department.  The only basic service available is electricity, medical clinic, school and church.  All the families that live there do so under these conditions.

Gloria’s commercial activity is raising pigs, sheep and barnyard fowl in corrals outside her house.  It’s worth pointing out that Gloria has four years’ experience which has allowed her to retain her business’ regular clientele.  She sells her animals to local wholesalers.  In addition, her husband works his fields where he has 1.5 hectares of rice planted that’s developing properly and producing additional income.

Gloria has proposed increasing her inventory with respect to raising animals because it’s a very profitable activity in the zone and this is why she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a new loan in the amount of 1000 new soles to buy animal feed and to repair the corrals which in time will allow her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and to repair corrals.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a hardworking entrepreneur and owns a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business. Cecelia has been in this business for 30 years. Cecelia earns more income from buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats). 

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money in order to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Irsa

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Irsa es originaria de nacimiento del municipio de Achuapa, desde muy joven le ha gustado trabajar para generar sus propios ingresos y desde que formó su hogar le ha apoyado a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la construcción de su vivienda.
Hoy en la actualidad  tiene su propio negocio el cual consiste en brindar servicio de comidería que inició con esfuerzo propio donde lleva muchos años de operar ubicado en su vivienda, el cual es muy concurrido y conocido por los habitantes de dicho municipio y sus visitantes, caracterizado por la buena calidad de la comida y el trato amable de la dueña.
Es la primera ocasión que solicita crédito en Ceprodel, ya que se ve en la necesidad de contar con capital para comprar insumos para la elaboración de la comida y refrescos como verduras, pollo, carne de res, carne de cerdo, gaseosas, aceite y arroz con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, ya que esta está creciendo cada día más.
texts.en:
Claudia was born in the town of Achuapa.  From a very young age she’s liked to work to generate her own income and since she formed her own home she’s helped her husband with household expenses and to build their house.

At present, she has her own business consisting in running a café at home that she started with her own efforts and that has been in operation for many years.  It is quite popular and well-known by residents and visitors in said town; it’s noted for the good quality of the food and for the owner’s kind service.

This is the first time she’s asked Ceprodel for a loan because she needs to have capital to buy ingredients like vegetables, chicken, beef, pork, oil, rice and soft drinks to prepare her food and refreshments to meet customer demand which is growing more every day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken, beef, pork, soft-drinks, oil and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente  est  présidente l’association de crédit  Espoir, Femme courageuse, infatigable, entrepreneur, âgée de 60 ans, divorcée, mère de 7 enfants, parmi ces naissances, il ya des jumeaux. Tous ses enfants ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse  de Jus local Mandale. Elle commença son business avec le fonds propre reçu de son mari avant qu’ils divorcent.  Alors, elle bénéficia le premier  crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour fonds additionnels vers les années 2008. Dit-elle,  cette activité a fait grandir ses enfants, c’est à dire  les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité. Elle vend son produit  à son domicile. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  12eme  cycle de crédit. La cliente a décidé de réduire son montant de crédit suite à la  crise financière qui profile à l’horizon. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’approvisionner des matières premières de production Jus Mandale (2 sacs de maïs, sorgho, etc.). En plus, elle ambitionne acheter d’autres parcelles pour ces enfants. La cliente remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
This client is the president of the loan association Espoir. A brave and tireless woman and an entrepreneur, she is 60 years old, divorced, and the mother of seven children. Among the births, there are twins. All of the children have their own homes already. 

She sells "mandale", a local beverage. She started her business with her own funds from her husband before they divorced. Then she benefited from an initial loan as additional funding around 2008 from the microfinance institution Hekima. She says that this business has brought up her children, that is, the profits from her business went toward savings, food, and schooling costs. 

She makes her sales out of her home. However, she just obtained her 12th loan. This client decided to reduce the loan amount because a financial crisis is looming. This new loan must serve to supply her with the ingredients for making "mandale" drink (2 sacks of corn, sorghum, etc.)  In addition, her ambition is to buy more plots of land for her children. 

This client thanks Hekima and her partners for their actions helping poor women with low incomes to become autonomous.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (2 sacks of corn, sorghum, etc.) for making a local drink

loans.name: Salvita

texts.en:
Salvita is 53 years old and married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Salvita runs a "sari sari" (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like sugar, shampoo,soap, etc. for her "sari sari" store.

Salvita has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, soap, soft drinks, etc.. 

In the future, Salvita would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Reymunda

texts.es:
Reymunda tiene 40 años, está casada con Michel, con quien tiene 5 hijos varones. Todos ellos viven en una casa alquilada en el distrito de San Ramón- Chanchamayo.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que desde hace 4 años que se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores como: cuyes, conejos, gallinas, patos, etc., los que cría en un corral acondicionado en un espacio de su hogar. Antes de realizar esta actividad sólo atendía las labores del hogar, pero como sus hijos iban creciendo las necesidades eran mayores, por eso no dudó en empezar con la crianza de cuyes. Ahora cría y vende más animales. “Cada cuy lo vendo de 18 a 20 soles, sí es rentable”, menciona. Sus principales compradores son restaurantes de comida típica y clientes que conoció desde que empezó con el negocio.
Uno de sus objetivos es conseguir un puesto de ventas en el mercado de su ciudad, para evitar lo fastidioso que puede ser cargar la mercadería y llevarla hasta sus clientes.

Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se compromete a pagar puntualmente las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, se siente contenta de saber que en conjunto podrán luchar por sus metas.
El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más animales (cuyes, gallinas y patos) para criarlos y luego venderlos.
texts.en:
Raymunda, 40, is married to Michel; they have five boys.  They all live together in a rented house in San Ramón-Chanchamayo District.

She is a very hardworking woman who for the last four years has been buying and selling small farm animals like guinea pigs, rabbits, chickens, ducks, etc. that she raises in a corral set up in a space at home.  Before going into this activity she only did household chores but as her children grew need increased so she didn’t hesitate to start raising guinea pigs.  

Now she raises and sells more animals.  “I sell each guinea pig for 18 to 20 soles; it is profitable,” she mentions.  Her main buyers are restaurants serving traditional fare and customers she’s known since she started the business.  One of her objectives is to get a sales stand in her city’s market to avoid the hassle of carrying her merchandise to her customers.

This would be her first MFP loan so she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She belongs to the “Las Triunfadoras” (The Successful Ones) communal bank and she feels happy to know that they will be able to strive towards their goals together.

The money she’s requesting will be invested in the purchase of more animals (guinea pigs, chickens and ducks) to raise for subsequent sale.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 67 years old and married with 8 children.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Vilma has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running a general store for 30 years and also earns income from selling charcoal.

She aspires to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 8 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO 8 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ogoutcheyi Elisabeth est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ogoutcheyi Elisabeth est âgée de 56 ans et vit au Bénin. Ogoutcheyi Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Ogoutcheyi Elisabeth est mariée à un certain Maurice. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ogoutcheyi Elisabeth vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges, Ogoutcheyi Elisabeth vend depuis quinze ans, du riz préparé accompagné de sauce dans une école du Benin. Ogoutcheyi Elisabeth s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ogoutcheyi Elisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 8, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux prêts reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group "GBENONKPO 8" comprises three persons who are friends belonging to the same revolving credit association. This is the third time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for boosting their business. The group's representative, Ogoutcheyi Elisabeth, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 56 years old and lives in Benin. 

Elisabeth did not go to school. She is married to a man named Maurice. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. Elisabeth lives together with her children and husband and ensures, along with her husband, the different household expenses are covered. 

To cover her diverse expenses, Elisabeth has been selling rice dishes serviced with sauces for fifteen years at a school in Benin. She gets her supplies  from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, Elisabeth is requesting, along with the other members of the group GBENONKPO 8, a third loan fro ALIDé. The two loan received previously were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, peanut oil, and some condiments

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita, 67, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and mother to her child. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anita operates a rug-making business. She and her child manage their own household while operating the business. Anita mainly offers rugs, from those round, palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats, as well as other crafts that most rug-makers offer. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, Anita is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy more raw materials, like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Anita hopes to increase production and dreams of being able to give her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 34 años, está casada con Wilder, con quien tiene 2 hijos (de 11 y 9 años). Ella y su familia viven en la casa de sus familiares ubicada en el distrito de San Ramón- Chanchamayo.

Durante su vida a realizado varias actividades. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de carne de domicilio en domicilio. Es una labor sacrificada, pero lo hace con mucho entusiasmo para sacar adelante a su familia. “Hace 4 años que vendo carne de res, carnero y chancho”, menciona.
Para esto, ella visita a los carniceros mayoristas a quienes compra su mercadería, luego distribuye la carne en los restaurantes y familias, quienes ya la conocen y confían en la calidad de las carnes que ofrece. La venta es rentable, compra 1 kilo de carne de res a 10 soles y lo vende a 12, ganando 2 soles por kilo.  En adelante quiere vender más productos, por ahora empezará con quesos. Uno de sus objetivos es vivir en una casa propia, para ello continuará trabajando duro.

Esta sería la primera vez que Yolanda accedería a un crédito de MFP, por eso da su palabra de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas. Además dice que le agrada la idea de trabajar con personas luchadoras y responsables en su banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras”.
Con el dinero  solicitado podrá adquirir varios kilos de carne, y de quesos que ofrecerá a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 34, is married to Wilder; they have two children (11 and 9 years old).  They all live together in a family member’s house in San Ramón-Chanchamayo District.

She’s carried out various activities throughout her life.  At present, she sells meat door to door.  It’s very demanding work but she does it with much enthusiasm in order to move her family ahead.  “I’ve been selling beef, pork and lamb for four years,” she mentions.  To do so, she visits wholesale butchers to buy her merchandise that she then sells to restaurants and to families who know her and trust the quality of meats she offers.  Sales are profitable.  She buys a kilo of beef for 10 soles and sells it for 12, earning 2 soles per kilo.  Later on she wants to sell more products and for now will start with cheeses.  One of her objective is to live in a house of her own and will continue working hard to accomplish this.

This would be Yolanda’s first loan from MFP so she gives her word that she’ll pay her installments punctually.  Besides, she says that it pleases her to work with hardworking, responsible people like the ones in her “Las Triunfadoras” (The Successful Ones) communal bank.

She will use the requested money to buy several kilos of meat and cheeses to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Mahugnon 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON 3 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent au même groupe de tontine. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mahoussi Hélène est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mahoussi Hélène est âgée de 54 ans et vit au Bénin. Mahoussi Hélène n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Mahoussi Hélène est mariée à un maçon du nom de Richard. Le couple a deux enfants dont un est scolarisé et tous deux à leur charge. Mahoussi Hélène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin de répondre efficacement aux besoins de sa famille, Mahoussi Hélène vend depuis vingt trois ans, de la nourriture ( riz accompagné de friture, spaghettis) dans une école du Benin. Mahoussi Hélène s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mahoussi Hélène sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON 3, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Mahugnon 3 group is composed of three individuals living in the same district and belonging to the same community savings group. This is the third time that the group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé, with the goal of expanding their business activities. The group’s representative, by the name of Mahoussi Helene, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Mahoussi Helene is 54 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to Richard, a stonemason. They have two dependent children, one of whom is in school. Mahoussi Helene lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various household needs. In order to be able to meet her family’s needs efficiently, for 23 years, Mahouss helene has been selling cooked  dishes (rice with fried fish, spaghetti) at a school of Benin. Mahoussi Helene stocks up in Benin. Wishing to meet customer need and increase her sales volume and her revenues, Mahoussi Helene, together with the other members of the Mahugnon 3 group, is seeking her third loan from ALIDé. The two prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice,  condiments and heating wood.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: Daniel est âgé de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Daniel est marié à une marchande du nom de Jeanne. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge dont quatre constituent leurs propres enfants. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Daniel vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Daniel n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la menuiserie. Pour répondre aux divers besoins de la maison, Daniel exerce cette activité depuis dix huit ans. Daniel s’approvisionne en madriers dans une ville du Benin. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère cette activité, Daniel contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Daniel sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Daniel ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Daniel is 34 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to merchant named Jeanne. The couple take care of five children, of whom four are their own. Some of the children have had schooling. Daniel lives together with his children and wife. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

Daniel did not go to school but learned woodworking. To respond to the diverse household needs, he has been working at this business for eighteen years. He gets his supplies of lumber from a city in Benin. Thanks to the revenues this business generates, he helps with the different household expenses. 

To satisfy the needs of his burgeoning customer base, Daniel is requesting for the third time a loan from ALIDé. The loans previously received by him were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy lumber for making furniture

loans.name: Las 3 Princesas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama las 3 princesas quienes viven en un barrio llamado "trinidad".
Gladys es soltera y aun vive con sus padres, ella tiene 26 años de edad  y  es independiente ya que consigue para sí sus propios ingresos.
Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra ropas, ella va a utilizar el préstamo para surtir su negocio y de esta manera trabajar junto con su mamá y su hermana, pues ellas trabajan en el mismo negocio.
Inicio con esta actividad hace cuatro meses apoyando a su hermana  y decidió asociarse con ella para poder comprar mas ropa y de mejor calidad y juntar poder tener un mejor ingreso y seguir adelante con el préstamo.
Lo que desea es que con el préstamo y esta actividad que decidió tener ella logre agrandarlo cada día y con el tiempo pueda tener un local en donde vender ya qué por el momento está vendiendo en la calle.
Las personas que integran en el grupo son:   la señora  Lucila  quien invierte en la compra de café para luego venderlo  molido y la señora  María Febe  quien invertirá en la compra de materiales para elaborar blusas bordadas de manta.
texts.en:
The group is called “Las 3 Princesas” (The 3 Princesses); they live in a neighborhood called Trinidad.

Gladys is singe and still lives with her parents.  She’s 26 years old and independent in that she earns her own income.

She requested the loan to buy clothes and will use the loan to stock her business and work together with her mother and sister since they all work in the same business.

She started with this activity four months ago helping her sister and decided to partner with her to be able to buy more, better quality clothes and so that together they would earn better income and continue forward with the loan.

What she wants is that with the loan and this activity she decided to have  she’ll succeed in enlarging it more each day so that in time she will be able to have a locale to sell in because for the moment she’s selling in the street.

The people who comprise the group are: Lucila who will buy coffee to grind and resell and María Febe who will buy supplies to manufacture unbleached cotton embroidered blouses.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
Don José Francisco es un señor de escasos recursos que se gana la vida laborando como operador de limpieza con muchos años de experiencia en este oficio, labor que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su humilde hogar.
En Ceprodel le han otorgado seis créditos todos para gastos personales como mejorar su salud o la de su esposa y hoy en día está solicitando el sexto crédito para seguir mejorando su salud y seguir luchando en la vida para tener un mejor vivir con su esposa, ya que todos sus hijos son independientes que se valen por sí solos.
Confía en Dios que su solicitud se aprobada para comprar la medicina adecuada y pagar las consultas médicas, ya que con su salario no puede cubrir estos costos altos y los micro créditos son la única opción para resolver estos gastos.
texts.en:
José Francisco is a man of scarce resources who makes a living as a cleaning operator. He has worked in this area for a long time, and his work allows him to have food for each day and live in a humble house.

Ceprodel has given José six loans for personal expenses, such as health care for José or his wife. He is requesting this present loan to continue improving his health and to continue fighting for a better quality of life for himself and his wife. All of their children are grown and live own their own. 

José believes that God will use this loan to help him buy the medicine he needs and to help with medical bills. His salary cannot cover his high medical costs, and micro loans are his only option to address these expenses.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses.

loans.name: Happy Ayllu Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Happy Ayllu” en el distrito del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por trece personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de vitaminas, venta de productos naturales y otros brindan servicios como por ejemplo brindan servicios de salón de belleza y agencia de viajes. 

(La señora Alejandrina está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Alejandrina nació en la ciudad de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la Alejandrina es la venta de artículos de baños, artículos  de dormitorios, artículos de limpieza, artículos de cocina y otras cosas. Ya son 8 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Alejandrina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo, cepillos, toallas, batas y otras cosas más, ella compra mercadería de las ciudades de Lima, Desaguadero, La Paz y Tacna. Su sueño de la señora Alejandrina es sacar profesionales a sus hijos y tener una cadena de tiendes de venta. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the “Happy Ayllu” communal bank in the district of Cusco.  This communal bank has 13 members who seek at every moment opportunities to get ahead and with their daily efforts provide a better future for their children.  The economic activities they carry out are varied.  We have, for example, vitamin sales, natural products sales; some provide services like beauty salon and travel agency.

(Alejandrina is raising her hand in the photo).  She was born in the city of Cusco and still lives in the city of her birth.  She’s 50 years old, married and has three children.  Her main economic activity is selling bathroom items, bedroom items, cleaning supplies, kitchen items and others.  She’s been in this business for 8 years now and she does very well.  On this occasion, Alejandrina needs the loan to buy merchandise like brushes, towels, robes and other things.  She will buy the merchandise in the cities of Lima, Desaguadero, La Paz and Tacna.  Alejadrina’s dream is to see her children become professionals and to have a chain of stores.

The members in general are grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to make their various installment payments according to the established schedule.

Cusco is located in Cusco District and Province belonging to Cusco Department in the very heart of the ancient city of the Incas.  It’s noted for being a tourist zone because of its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery and for its history; it’s an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone and for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located there.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise.

loans.name: Lizandro

texts.es:
Lizandro tiene 30 años, está casado con Marisol, con quien tiene 5 hijos a los que quiere y cuida mucho. Ellos viven en la casa de unos familiares ubicada en el distrito de San Ramón – Chanchamayo. 

Él es un hombre carismático y alegre. Actualmente trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una entidad estatal. Lleva más de 1 año en este cargo y se siente cómodo con su labor, ya que percibe un sueldo fijo mensual. En sus ratos libres apoya en actividades de construcción, así puede obtener ingresos extras y darse algunos gustos. Así también, tiene un negocio de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad instalado en su casa, el que atiende Marisol y sus hijos. Sus ventas son buenas y los clientes van a su local con frecuencia, por ello siempre tiene que adquirir la mercadería necesaria para abastecer a todos. “Compramos al por mayor en la madrugada, los productos más frescos”, dice. De esta manera le brinda a sus hijos el sustento necesario para sus estudios y vestido. Una de sus metas es construir su casa propia, para ello seguirá trabajando y ahorrando.

Esta es la primera vez que accede a un crédito con MFP, por eso da su palabra de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, cuyas integrantes son mujeres en su mayoría, y menciona que será constante en el trabajo dentro del grupo.
Con el dinero solicitado podrá comprar la mercadería necesaria para surtir su negocio de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, aceite, conservas y kilos de carne.
texts.en:
Lizandro is 30 years old and married to Marisol.  The couple have five children who they care for and love very much.  They live in a house belonging to some family members which is located in San Ramón - Chanchamayo, Peru. 

Lizandro is a charming and cheerful man.  He currently works as a security guard in a state institution.  He has been in this position for more than a year and he feels comfortable with his job as it makes him a fixed monthly age.  In his free time he works on construction sites so that he can make extra income and afford himself some pleasures.  He also has a business selling groceries and basic household products. This business is located in his home and his wife, Marisol, and his children work in it.  "We buy our products wholesale early in the morning.  We buy the freshest products" he says.  In this way, he is able to provide his children with clothing and an education.  One of his goals is to build his own home.  He will continue working and saving in order to achieve this.

This is the first time that Lizandro has applied for a loan from MFP.  He gives his word that he will make his monthly repayments punctually.  He is a member of the 'Las Triunfadoras' community bank whose members are mostly women.  He says that he will be steadfast as regards his work within the group.  Lizandro will use the money he has requested to buy the merchandise he needs to stock his grocery business such as rice, sugar, oil, canned food and kilos of meat.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise

loans.name: Glesandra

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Glesandra works hard to support her family.

She has a rice grains retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Glesandra is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her rice grains business.

Glesandra has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Vénan André

texts.fr: Vénan André est âgé de 51 ans et vit au Benin. Vénan André n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Vénan André est marié à une marchande du nom Antoinette. Le couple a huit enfants à leur charge dont sept constituent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Vénan André vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Vénan André mène comme activité la couture depuis vingt deux ans dans une région du Benin. Vénan André s’approvisionne en fournitures de couture dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’améliorer son activité, Vénan André sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Vénan André is 51 years old and lives in Benin. He did not go to school. He is married to a merchant named Antoinette. They take care of eight children, of whom seven are their own. All of the children are in school. André lives together with his wife and children. The diverse household expenses are jointly covered by the couple. 

André has been running a tailoring business for 22 years in a region of Benin. He gets his supplies of sewing materials in his region. 

Seeking to satisfy his customers and aiming to improve his business, André is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The loans previously received were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 50 años, vive con su pareja, con quien tiene 2 hijos (de 29 y 18 años). Sus hijos ya salieron de su hogar, ahora ella y su pareja habitan una casa alquilada ubicada en el distrito de San Ramón – Tarma.


Ella es una mujer muy empeñosa. Con la ayuda de su pareja han consolidado un negocio de compra y venta de frutas, el que consideran rentable. “Voy hasta las mismas chacras y traigo la mercadería, y la vendo en un puesto en San Ramón”, menciona.
Lleva más de 10 años en este negocio, y ya sabe como funciona. Esta temporada lo más rentable es vender piñas y cítricos.  De esta manera ha podido mantener a sus 2 hijos y brindarles una educación adecuada. Al momento cuenta con algunos ahorros producto de sus ventas, con eso piensa adquirir un carro para movilizarse con facilidad.

Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al reciente banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” y cree que el trabajo será satisfactorio.
Con el dinero solicitado podrá adquirir cajas de mandarinas, naranjas, paltas y otras frutas para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maruja, 50, lives with her spouse with whom she has two children (29 and 18 years old).  Her children have left the home already and now she and her spouse live in a rented house in the San Ramón-Tarma District.

She is a very dedicated woman.  With help from her spouse she’s consolidated a business buying and selling fruit which they consider profitable.  “I go to the very fields and bring merchandise to sell in a stand in San Ramón,” she mentions.  She’s been in this business for more than 10 years and she knows how it functions.  This season selling pineapples and citrus fruit is the most profitable.  In this way she’s managed to support her two children and provide them with an adequate education.  At the moment, she has some savings from her sales that she plans to use to buy a car to get around more easily.

This will be her first MFP loan so she gives her word that she’ll be punctual with her installment payments.  She belongs to the “Las Triunfadoras” (The Successful Ones) communal bank and she believes its work is satisfactory.

She will use the requested money to buy cases of mandarins, oranges, avocados and other fruit to stock her business.
