The group "el Aguacate" [The Avocado] comprises three hardworking, enterprising members. One of them is Silvia del Carmen, who has been selling clothing and foodstuffs for 4 years. She will use the loan to buy merchandise (shirts, pants, jeans, and blouses) and basic grains, meats, etc.

The other members are Eloisa and Blanca, who have also been selling a variety of apparel items for several years.

loans.use: to buy apparel (shirts, pants, jeans, and blouses) and basic grains, meats, etc.

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali is 43 years old, married and has six children. For the past two years, she has run a retail shop and managed to employ one person. She is also a farmer.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mwikali has improved her business because she has been trained in business management skills. She is now requesting 20,000 KES loan to buy sugar, rice and maize flour to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Julio

texts.es:
Pedro   es un hombre que tiene  32años de edad, de estado civil  soltero, además  cuenta con 01 hijo que es menor de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Pedro vive en  el  distrito de Morropón del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, agua y desagüe; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 800 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Pedro  es la  venta de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, menestras, huevos, leche, aceite, fideos, detergentes, golosinas, bebidas, etc., esta pequeña bodega la tiene instalada en su  domicilio , donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidel izados; así mismo también su cònyuge  esta dedicada a la  crianza de aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  Pedro   cuenta con 3 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este  negocio.  
Actualmente Pedro se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial (bodega) y a la crianza de animales menores, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1,508 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de mercadería (abarrotes);  lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 32 years old, and is in a civil union. He has one son, who depends on him. He lives in a rural, subsistence community, where the majority of the residents are independent workers who work in various trades, raising animals, and working in agriculture. Pedro lives in the Morropón District in the Department of Piura, which has access to electricity, water and drainage. Their community consists of 800 families.

Pedro makes a living selling basic staple goods, such as: rice, sugar, beans, eggs, milk, oil, pasta, detergent, candies, drinks, etc. He runs his business out of his home, and he attends clients there. His partner works raising barnyard birds in corrals outside their home. Pedro has three years of experience in his business, which has allowed him to build and maintain his customer base. 

Presently, Pedro wants to increase his inventory for his business, as well as expand their operation raising animals, since it is a very profitable activity in the area. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,508 nuevos soles, which he will invest in purchasing merchandise for their businesses. In time, he hopes this investment will allow him to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Munkhtuul

texts.en:
Munkhtuul is a 35-year-old married woman with three daughters.  She lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent.  The ger district Munkhtuul and her family live in is outside of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia and lacks basic infrastructure.  

Her three daughters all attend school, one is in college, one is in high school and one is in kindergarten. Munkhtuul works 3-4 days at a local bus company; she would like to operate her own taxi service business the other three day of the week.  She is requesting a loan for 3.000.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase a car to operate a taxi service in order to increase her family's income. She says she would like to build a savings fund to build a new house for her lovely daughters.  Munkhtuul emotionally states that if her daughters are happy and safe, she will became the happiest mother in the world.

loans.use: to buy a car to operate a taxi service in order to increase her family's income.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en: Pha is 49 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than six years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her husband is a chef who earns about $3 per day. Two of her children are employed, one in a garment factory and the other in Malaysia, they earn about $15 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Pha is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase farmland to use for agricultural crops cultivation. The borrowed money will enable Pha to gain the needed security to start a new business and earn more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and help her children receive a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for agricultural crops cultivation.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: La señora Leticia es un cliente distinguido de la institución  ya que a lo largo de  sus   créditos  se  ha caracterizado por  tener  una excelente  cultura  de  pagos,  ella se  dedica a la  venta  de  ropa   lo cual le  a  permitido  sacar a  su  familia  adelante,  en esta  ocasión  el requiere  realizar   la  compra  de   ropa  para  vender,  ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio  permitiéndole  generar   mayores  ingresos  por  lo que se  encuentra  muy  contenta  de  habernos  encontrado.
texts.en: Leticia is a distinguished loan recipient, since she has worked consistently over time to always make on time payments. She makes a living selling clothing, which allows her to provide for her family. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase clothing for resale, and she sees this loan as an opportunity to grow her business and generate more income. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Torn

texts.en: Torn is 44 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a palm juice vendor who earns about $4 per day. Two of her children are garment workers who earn about 6 per day. Due to lack of funds, Torn is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a computer for her son to use in his university studies. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a computer for her son to use in his university studies.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las hormiguitas las integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre, porque dicen ser muy trabajadoras y perseverantes para alcanzar lo que  se proponen, es por eso que decidieron nombrar de esta manera a su grupo, esta historia es acerca de la señora amada ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella cuenta con 30 años de edad y está casada con el señor Andrés con quien tiene 4 hijos, quienes cursan primero, cuarto y sexto año de primaria y el menor esta en segundo año de preescolar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida manteles hace 10 años.

Doña amada se decidió por este negocio, ya que dice quería buscar la forma de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, también para darle una muy buena educación a sus pequeños hijos, va a invertir su crédito en la compra de mas insumos como son: jitomates, chiles, cebollas, aceite, sal, arroz, frijol, maíz, carnes, etc.

El sueño que ella tiene es el de construir un local para poner un pequeño restaurante, y así continuar con sus ventas, tenerla mucho mas surtida y con más variedad de platillos, puesto que así obtendrá más y mejores ingresos, para con esto poder continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios ya que así tendrán una buena carrera profesional.

Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio empezara a mejorar mucho, su vida y la de su familia también cambiara.

Las integrantes del grupo y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: celiflora inocencia-abarrotes, Yolanda-tienda de ropa, lisbeth-tienda de ropa, divina-venta de frutas y verduras y amada-venta de comida
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Hormiguitas" (The Little Ants). The members of the group decided upon this name because they are hardworking and persevering whenever they set out to accomplish something. They decided this name would match up with the qualities of their group.

The story being presented is that of Sra. Amada, one of the members of this group. She is 30 years old and married to Sr. Andrés. They have four children, three of whom are in the first, fourth, and sixth grades. The youngest one is in the second year of preschool. Amada has been preparing and selling food for 10 years. Doña Amada decided to go into this business because she was looking for a way to improve her quality of life and that of her family. She also wanted to provide a very good education for her young children. Amada will invest her loan in the purchase of supplies such as tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, oil, salt, rice, beans, corn, meat, and other ingredients.

She dreams of building a shop where she can open a small restaurant and continue her sales. Amada wants to have more inventory so that she can prepare a wider variety of dishes. This will help her generate more income so that she can continue supporting her children with their studies and help them to achieve a professional career. Amada is extremely grateful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva for their support by providing this loan. As a result, her business will begin to experience great improvement. Her life and that of her family will also change.

The members of the group and their businesses are listed below: • Celifora Inocencia sell groceries. • Yolanda manages a clothing store. • Lisbeth manages a clothing store. • Divina sells fruits and vegetables. • Amada sells food.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, oil, salt, rice, beans, corn, meat, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is a 52-year-old married man with eight children, six of whom are in school. He operates a grocery where he sells his goods at the market. He has been in this business for the last ten years, and he aspires to open a kiosk in future. Anderson owns a house that has no electricity or piped water.  He faces a major challenge during the dry season as vegetables and fruits become scarce. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

With the loan of KES 20000, he will be able to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLITAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Sebastiana es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de salchipapas, juegos electrónicos, confección de polleras, venta de comida, venta de fruta.

La señora Sebastiana, indica que  hace año y medio que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de promotores de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de material de plástico que viene trabajando hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la aumentar su capital (compra de materiales de plástico)  mismo que comprará de las ferias paceñas y posteriormente lo comercializará en las comunidades de la las comunidades del departamento de La Paz. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene ocho hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros, el área de salud y los pagos pacientes.
texts.en:
The Community Association “ESTRELLITAS” (Little Stars), is in its second program cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Focal Villa Adela Center. This group is made up of eight members and is managed by a board of directors, of which Sebastiana is president. The members all work in various businesses, including: sales of salchipapas (a hot dog and fried potatoes dish), electronic games, shawl making, food sales, fruit sales, etc.

Sebastiana became a member of the Pro Mujer association about a year and a half ago. She was invited to join by the institution’s promoters. She presently makes a living selling plastic materials, a business that she has had for some time. 

She plans to utilize the support from this loan to purchase additional materials for her business, which she will buy in the markets in La Paz, and then resell in the communities in her area. This work helps her to support her family. She is single and has eight children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Sebastiana commented that she likes the savings, as well as their work in health and patient payments.

loans.use: to purchase plastic materials.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan is 59 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than three years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about 2 USD per day. Her children are employed. They earn about 9 USD per day. Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Chan is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce her transportation expenses. In the future she would like to run a tailoring shop for her daughter and build a new house next year.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Tessito Gadamayo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé en janvier 1998 à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il est composé de braves femmes qui sont issues du même quartier, ce groupe est caractérisé par sa solidarité. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Assise  à gauche de la photo et la main levée  madame  est l’emprunteur vedette  responsable du groupe. Elle  âgée de 48 ans, est  mariée et mère de cinq enfants qu’elle prend en charge. 
Elle est vendeuse de tissus teintés communément appelés « THIOUB » qu’elle achète dans la sous région et d’encens plus connu sous l’appellation de « THIOURAYE ». Elle vend ses produits par placement qui n’excède pas de mois. Très rompue à la tâche, elle jouit d’une très bonne connaissance de cette activité pour l’avoir  pratiqué depuis plus de 10 ans.  
Ce nouveau prêt va lui permettra de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante en tissus et encens pour la revente.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle tirera de son activité, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants et constituer une épargne considérable pour d’éventuels investissements
texts.en:
The group was formed in January 1998 at the inauguration of their banc villageois.  It is made up of women from the same neighborhood and is characterized by solidarity.  The women's primary business is small-scale sales.

The client seated at left in the photo, with her hand raised, is the group leader.  She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of five children in her care.  She sells dyed fabric called "thioub", which she buys in the area, and incense known as "thiouraye".  She sells her products in an investment cycle no longer than two months.  Very experienced in this area, she knows her business well after having run it for more than ten years.  This new loan will allow her to buy a sufficient amount of fabric and incense to re-sell.

With the profit from her business, she plans to support her husband in paying for their children's education, and to put away a considerable sum for future investments.

loans.use: to buy fabric and incense to sell.

loans.name: Unidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidad lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ella es Rosa Argentina quien se dedica a la venta de chiverías y frutas desde hace 5 años en un colegio.  El crédito lo invertirá en gaseosas, meneítos, mango, jocote…etc. para surtir su pequeño kiosko.
Rosa está casada con Ronaldo quien es transportista y con quien tiene cuatro hijos por los cuales ambos trabajan arduamente.
Las otras integrantes son Cecilia quien tiene una pulpería e invertirá en granos básicos y Marina quien vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
Unidad Group ("unity") is composed of three hard-working and enterprising people. One of them is Rosa Argentina who has been selling snacks and fruit at a school for five years. She will invest her loan in soft drinks, cheese puffs, mangoes, cashew nuts, etc. to stock up her small stand. Rosa is married to Ronaldo, a road haulier, with whom she has four children. Both parents work arduously to provide for them.

The other group members are Celia, who owns a grocery and will invest her loan share in staple grains, and Marina, who has been selling clothes and cosmetics for six years.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cheese puffs, mangoes, cashew nuts, etc. to stock up her small stand.

loans.name: Kambeng Doumassou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Banc Villageois de Kambeng Doumassou a été créé le 15 Novembre  2006 à l’occasion de son inauguration du. Il est composé de  femmes très actives dans les activités génératrices de revenu, plus particulièrement le petit commerce. Une bonne entente anime la vie de groupe.

Madame Aminata assise au milieu dans la photo et en médaillon en bas à droite  est l’emprunteur vedette. Elle est âgée de 65 ans, est  mariée et mère de dix enfants dont trois garçons et de sept filles. Très déterminée, elle achète des articles vestimentaires en gros pour la revente dans son quartier et les quartiers environnants. Elle est très expérimentée dans l’activité commerciale.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour l’écouler dans le marché local.
Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle compte appuyer ses enfants dans leur différente activité.
texts.en:
The Kambeng Doumassou Banc Villageois group was created on November 15, 2006, at the inauguration of the banc villageois.  It is made up of women who are very active in business, particularly small-scale sales.  The members have a good group relationship.

Aminata, seated in the center and also pictured in the corner inset of the photo, is the featured borrower.  She is 65 years old, married, and the mother of ten children, three boys and seven girls.  Very determined, she buys clothing wholesale to re-sell in her neighborhood and nearby neighborhoods.  She is very experienced in this business.

Her new loan will allow her to buy enough inventory to sell on the local market.  With the profits, she plans to support her children in their various activities.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell on the local market.

loans.name: Johanna Del Rocio

texts.es:
Johanna  , tiene 30 años  es soltera  y actualmente vive en Guayaquil con sus padres,
Su negocio lo inicio hace 9 años , comenzó en la bahía donde compro ropa y la vendió en los mercados cercanos a su barrio y a personas conocidas le ofreció sus ropas variadas, su trabajo lo desempeña los fines de semanas en horas de la mañana  hasta el medio día , ya que de lunes a viernes tiene un trabajo fijo en unas cabinas telefónicas con eso se ayuda en su economía.
No tiene dificultades en su trabajo, solo enfermarse ya que esto conllevaría  a que no pueda salir a negociar su mercadería , con el préstamo va a mejorar su inventario para poder ofrecer mejor calidad de ropa y mayor  variedad .
Su sueño es poder tener un negocio propio en cual pueda vender y ropa y utilizarlo como cabinas telefónicas ya que sabe el manejo.
texts.en:
Johanna is 30 years old, and is single and lives in Guayaquil with her parents. She started her own business nine years ago, and started in the main markets where she buys clothing and then resells it in the neighborhoods around her home to people she knows. She works on her clothing business on the weekends, since she has another job during the week at a store that owns and operates public telephone booths. These jobs help her generate income to help with expenses and her finances.  

She does not have difficulties with her jobs, but she has had some health challenges, and those challenges mean that she cannot get out as much to negotiate for good clothing merchandise. This loan will help her to improve her inventory so that she can offer a better variety and higher quality product to her clients. 

Her dream is to have her own business and to a physical space of her own for the business. She hopes that space will work for both her clothing sales and to offer telephone booth services, since she knows how to operate and manage them.

loans.use: to buy her own space for her business.

loans.name: Gabriela Elizabeth

texts.es: Gabriela  es cliente  distinguida  de la institución,  a lo largo  de sus créditos se  ha  caracterizado  por  tener  una excelente  cultura  de  pagos, ella  en este  momento   se  acerco a la  institución  ya que  requiere  realizar   mejoras  en su  cocina quiere   colocar azulejo en las  paredes   , además  de  construir  una  barra   de   concreto, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado para  la  realización de su  proyecto  ya  que    tendrá  mayor  comodidad   al  cocinar.
texts.en: Gabriela is a distinguished loan recipient, as she has consistently shown a record of making on time payments. She is presently requesting a loan to help with improvements to her kitchen, as she wants to install ceiling tiles, and construct a concrete bar for additional work space. She is grateful for the support she has received for her project, and looks forward to enjoying a more comfortable working space in her kitchen.

loans.use: to hang ceiling tiles, and construct a concrete bar in her kitchen.

loans.name: Orlando David

texts.es: Orlando es de Quevedo y tiene 24 años. Su esposa trabaja vendiendo cosméticos en el tiempo libre ya que cuida a su hijo. Orlando nos cuenta que en los próximos meses volverá a recibir la visita de la cigüeña ya que su esposa está embarazada. Inicio su negocio hace 2 años cuando su cuñado le enseño la venta de ropa y poco a poco ha ido creciendo. También sabe de soldadura con ello elabora puertas metálicas junto a su tío. Como su negocio lo tiene en su domicilio no presenta mayor inconvenientes. El crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de ropa y una maquina de soldar para aumentar la venta de puertas y ventanas. En un futuro Orlando planea abrir su propio taller y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Orlando is from Quevedo and is 24 years of age. His wife sells cosmetics in her free time and also takes care of their son. Within the the next few months, Orlando says the stork will be paying him a visit since his wife is pregnant. He started his business two years ago when his brother-in-law introduced him to the clothing retail trade, and now his venture has grown. Orlando also knows how to weld, so he produces metal doors along with his uncle. Since he manages his business from home, Orlando does not face any major problems.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy clothing and a welding machine so that he can increase his sales of doors and windows. In the future, Orlando plans to open his own workshop so that he and his family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell and a welding machine for making doors and windows.

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es:
Hermes  es un hombre que tiene 42  años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con 3 hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Hermes vive en  el caserío José Olaya del distrito de Tambogrande y departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Hermes es la crianza/venta de ganado porcino, caprinos  y aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Hermes cuenta con 12 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; él vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo también esta dedicado a la agricultura donde tiene instalado 1.0 ha. De cultivo de limón donde   le permite tener otro ingresos
Actualmente Hermes se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.1000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de fertilizantes y pago de jornales de su cultivo instalado; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Hermes is 42 years old, is in a civil union, and has three children who depend on him. Their family lives in their own home.  Their community is a rural, subsistence community, and the majority of people are independent workers who make a living raising animals and working in agriculture. 

Hermes lives in the José Olava community in the district of Tambogrande, Department of Piura. Their community has access to basic services like electricity and water from a well. All the families in the area live in the same conditions. 

Hermes makes a living raising pigs, goats and birds in corrals outside his home, and has been raising animals for twelve years. He has built and maintained his client base for his business, and he sells animals to wholesalers in the area. He also is a farmer, and has planted one hectare of lemon trees to generate additional income.

Presently, Hermes wants to increase his inventory in his animal business, as it is a very profitable trade in the region. He is requesting a loan from Edpyma Alternativa in the amount of  1,000 nuevos soles, which he will invest in purchasing fertilizers and maintaining his crops. In time, he hopes this support will help him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and maintain his crops and animal sales business.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed, 30 years old and a married man, still has no children.

Majed has built a small kiosk over a cart in an active main road in Al Mafraq to sell hot drinks. He has applied for this youth loan to bring in more types of hot drinks like hot chocolate, and different herb teas. In the future Majed wants to have his cafe be one that would serve hot and cold drinks.

loans.use: to bring in more types of hot drinks

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn, 32, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a Khmer traditional medicine vendor who earns about $10 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Phorn is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more traditional medicine to resell. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new timber house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more traditional medicine to resell

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is 37 years old and a married woman. Her husband became a pick-up driver after he retired from his first job, to be able to support their big family as they have four sons and four daughters.

Amneh also wanted to participate in helping  her husband support the family, so she started a small retail business buying and selling shoes and footwear, and recently she added birds sales to what she does, too.

Now Amneh has applied for this loan in order to buy more birds and cages to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more birds and cages

loans.name: Usaha Jaya 19 Group

texts.en:
Nuraeni has been selling 'Gado-gado' (Indonesian mixed vegetables with peanut sauce) in front of her house for five years. She has already faced the challenge that her business goes up and down depending on the weather. She likes to run this business because she can help her husband who works as a laborer in a port to create more income for her family. 

Now she plans to use her part of the loan to buy more ingredients to make 'gado-gado' and 'soto' to sell. Other group members are selling fried snacks, chicken noodles, daily basic needs and opening an internet cafe.

loans.use: to pay for more ingredients to make 'gado-gado' (Indonesian mixed vegetables with peanut sauce) and 'soto' (chicken soup) to sell

loans.name: Jessica Milagro

texts.es:
Jessica es una joven de 25 años de edad, vive al lado de sus padres quienes se dedican a la agricultura y venden fruta en el mercado de su ciudad, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y en especial se cultiva el algodón, el plátano, maíz, entre otros; Jessica es una joven a la cual le gusta trabajar, sobre todo porque sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña lo que significaba el ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente; hace ya tres años Jessica se dedica a la venta de leche de vaca, al inicio le fue un poco difícil manejar su negocio pero poco a poco fue aprendiendo y mas aun que con esfuerzo ahora tiene 5 vacas, a las cuales cuida mucho como si fueran hijas suyas; en una ocasión una de sus vacas la empujo y cayó muy duro al suelo, ello cuando recién aprendió a ordeñar las vacas; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo que cuida mucho a sus vacas y por ello siempre le dan buena leche.

Jessica está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá una vaca, con esta mejora podrá aumentar su producción de leche y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así ella podrá seguir trabajando día a día para hacer realidad su ms grande sueño:” Ser el orgullo de sus padres y tener un establo de vacas y seguir creciendo en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Jessica is a young, 25-year-old woman who lives with her parents, who both work in agriculture and sell fruit in the city market. Their home is located in the city of Imperial, and is known for its hot climate and the cultivation of cotton, plantains, corn and other staples. Jessica is a hardworking person, and her parents taught her from a young age what it meant to work hard to make a living and to work for your daily bread. 

Three years ago, Jessica started selling cow’s milk. At the beginning, it was difficult to manage the business, but little by little she learned how to grow her operation, and she now has five cows that she takes care of as if they were her own children. One time, one of her cows knocked her over and she had a hard fall. She recently learned how to milk the cows, and she believes that her business is going so well because she is very kind to her clients and takes good care of her cows so that they give good milk. 

Jessica is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, which has allowed her to buy a cow and increase her milk production and income. She works hard every day in hopes of one day accomplishing her dream of making her parents proud, having a stable for her cows and a growing business.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 38 años, vive con Luis, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 4 años. Ella y su familia habitan en su casa propia en el distrito de San Pedro de Cajas – Tarma.

Hasta los 24 años Miriam se dedicaba a la agricultura, al lado de sus padres. Cuando inició una nueva vida con Luis, y su primer hijo, sus necesidades económicas aumentaron. De esta manera decidió dedicarse al tejido como negocio. Adquirió telares artesanales y eléctricos y empezó a vender lo que elaboraba. También, gracias a sus estudios en la escuela de Bellas Artes aprendió a pintar. Ahora ya cuenta con un taller de tejidos y pintura, donde trabaja todo el día, y cuando los pedidos son mayores tiene que trasnochar, “lo importante es que no falta trabajo”, menciona.
Con esta actividad puede otorgarle a su familia una calidad de vida mejor, y espera que siga siendo así cuando sus hijos sean mayores y sus exigencias en la educación aumenten.

Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por esa razón menciona que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas. Se siente a gusto trabajando con su banco comunal “Mujeres al Futuro”, porque sus socias son constantes y emprendedoras.
Con el dinero que solicita podrá comprar los materiales necesarios para elaborar sus tejidos y sus pinturas.
texts.en:
Miriam is 38 years old, and lives with Luis and their two children, ages 13 and 14. She and her family live in their own house in the district of San Pedro de Cajas – Tarma.

Until she was 24 years old, Miriam made a living working in agriculture with her parents. When she began a new life with Luis and their first son, their financial needs increased. She therefore decided to begin a weaving business. She acquired artisan and electric looms and began to sell her handiwork. Also, thanks to her studies at an arts school, she learned to paint. She now has a painting and weaving workshop where she works every day, and even some nights, when she has many customer orders. She believes that, “it is important never to be short of work.”

With this business she can help provide for her family and give them a better quality of life. She hopes things will continue work out even when her children are grown and have educational expenses.

This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she has always been punctual in making monthly payments. She is an active member in the community bank, “Mujeres al Futuro: (Women for the Future), and she enjoys the companionship of other kind, entrepreneurial women. With the support from this loan, she plans to buy the necessary materials to make her weavings and paintings.

loans.use: to purchase materials for weaving and painting.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a 37-year-old married man with five children aged between 6 months and 11 years. He sells dry goods to his community. He has a stall near his town's public market and he also sells in his house. Fernando sells men's and women's shirts, curtains and jeans. He is able to provide for his family through his business.

Fernando has requested a loan to buy more goods to sell such as curtains, shirts and jeans. This will help increase his sales and business profitability. Fernando plans to build a stock room in his house for his dry goods.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell such as curtains, shirts and jeans

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo, Rolando, y su hijo de 23 años, en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de San Pedro de Cajas – Tarma.

Ella se dedica a la confección de tejidos artesanales, los cuales vende en un puesto ubicado en el centro de su distrito. A la vez, comercia manualidades, tapices, cerámicas, adornos para el hogar, etc. De esta manera su clientela se siente atraída por las novedades.
“Casi 10 años me dedico al tejido y me gusta porque puedo crear nuevos modelos”, asegura.
Las ventas dependen de la constancia que ella tenga al ofrecer sus productos, por eso la mayor parte del día se encuentra en su puesto de ventas.
Su esposo llega del trabajo de la mina cada 20 días, y cuando esto sucede se dedican al cuidado de sus cultivos, ya que también siembran papas.
Nora es muy empeñosa, gracias a esta virtud, piensa ampliar su puesto de ventas y ofrecer más artículos.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y éste es su crédito número 8 con MFP, agradece la oportunidad para continuar con sus metas. Dentro de su grupo colabora con puntualidad en sus pagos y reuniones.
Nora invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de lana de oveja y de alpaca para realizar sus próximos tejidos.
texts.en:
Nora, age 46, lives with her husband, Roland, and her 23 year old son.  They live in their own house in the San Pedro de Cajas district in Tarma.

She makes hand-woven items that she sells at a stand in the center of her district.  At the same time, she sells crafts, tapestry, ceramics, and household decorations, etc.  That way her clientele is attracted by the novelties.  “Almost ten years ago I devoted myself to weaving, and I like it because I am able to create new designs,” she affirms.

The sales depend upon the perseverance she has to sell her products.  That is why the greater part of the day she can be found at her sales stand.

Her husband comes home from working in the mine every 20 days.  When this happens they devote themselves to taking care of their crops, because they also grow potatoes.

Nora is very hard-working.  Thanks to this virtue she plans on expanding her sales stand and offering more items for sale.

She belongs to the “Mujeres al Futuro” (Women for the Future) communal bank.  This is her eighth loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the opportunity to continue with her goals.  Within the group she collaborates punctually with her payments and the meetings.

Nora will use the requested money to buy wool from sheep and from alpacas to make her next weavings.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is taking out another loan of Ksh 50,000 to expand his existing business. He plans to top up this amount and purchase another motorcycle. The previous loan enabled him to service his motorcycle. He aspires to hire employees in future, and he describes that since the previous loan, his living standard and that of his family has improved.

loans.use: to top up this amount and purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 46 years old and is a married woman with five children. She manages a maintenance and repair shop with her husband. Her husband, who is an auto mechanic, repairs air-conditioners and assembles multicabs (a mini-jeepney). Carina does her best to manage their business well and take care of her family.

Carina is requesting a loan to purchase tools and multicab spare parts. Carina hopes for their business to grow and help more people. She dreams to have her own gas station in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tools and multicab spare parts

loans.name: Mwalimu

texts.en:
Mwalimu is a 34-year-old man who is married to Tabu. They have four children, all of whom attend school. For the last one and a half years, he has been selling charcoal to his neighbors from his home and he describes high transport cost to be his major drawback.

 Mwalimu lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are for food and rent. He plans to add to his stock of charcoal and firewood using his loan of Ksh 15,000.

loans.use: to add to his stock of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Juquilita 1 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre juquilita 1 los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre porque son muy devotos de la virgen de juquila, es por eso que escogieron este nombre, la historia es acerca de la señora jazmín Gisela quien es la representante de este grupo, cuenta con 33 años de edad y está casada con el señor Jorge quien es comerciante, tienen 2 hijos Daniel y armando los cuales cursan  primero y segundo año de primaria, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 4 años.

Doña Jazmín decidió iniciar con este pequeño negocio, por la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y sacar a sus hijos adelante, ya que no tenia la solvencia económica suficiente para conseguir darles una mejor educación, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como: aceite, leche, refrescos, galletas, sopas, azúcar, frijol, huevos, etc.

 
Ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y así poder hacerlo crecer mucho mas, puesto que quiere ampliar su local para poner su abarrotería y así incrementar y mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, también seguirá apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener una muy buena profesión y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Ella esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y con Fundación realidad, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio.

Otras de las compañeras de doña Jazmín son: verónica, Yolanda, patricia y modesta, quienes realizan variadas actividades como son: abarrotes, artículos domésticos, dulcería, venta de quesos y taller de costura.
texts.en:
This group goes by the name "Juquilita 1". The members of the group decided upon this name because they are extremely devoted to the Virgin of Juquila. For this reason, they selected this name.

The story being presented is that of Sra. Jazmín Gisela, who is the group representative. She is 33 years old and married to Sr. Jorge who works as a merchant. They have two children, Daniel and Armando, who are in the first and second grades. Jazmín has been managing a grocery store for four years.

Doña Jazmín decided to start this small business because she needed to improve her quality of life and that of her children. She also wanted to help her children get ahead, but she did not have sufficient financial resources to provide them with a better education. The loan she will receive will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise such as oil, milk, soft drinks, cookies, soups, sugar, beans, eggs, and other items. Jazmín wants to continue investing in her business so that it can grow even more. She plans to expand the facilities of her grocery store so that she can increase and improve her sales and her income. In addition, she would like to continue supporting her children with their studies so that they can pursue a good profession and have a better quality of life.

Jazmín is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders and to Fundación Realidad. Thanks to their help, she has been able to move forward and have her own business. Her fellow group members are Verónica, Yolanda, Patricia, and Modesta. They engage in different business activities such as selling groceries, selling household products, making candy, selling cheese, and operating a sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy oil, milk, soft drinks, cookies, soups, sugar, beans, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha is 49 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling food for more than six years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is employed in garment factory and earns about $5 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $3 per day. 

Pha would like to run an additional business in order to improve her family’s finances. With this goal in mind, Pha is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase farmland for growing agricultural crops. By doing so, she would earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for growing agricultural crops

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos  es un hombre que tiene 43  años de edad, de estado civil casado, con 3 hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Carlos vive en  el caserío Lagunas del distrito de Mòrrope y departamento de  Lambayeque, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Carlos es la crianza/venta de ganado porcino ,caprinos  y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Carlos cuenta con 17 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; él vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge también se dedica a  la venta de chicha de jora donde   le permite tener otro ingresos
Actualmente Carlos se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.4000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceado, arreglo de corrales y compra de arroz en verde, aprovechando esto la finalización de la campaña de arroz; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 43 year old man who is married with 3 dependent children. He lives with his wife in his own home. It is mentioned that the quality of life in the community is at the subsistence level. Most of the residents are independent workers in commerce and animal husbandry and some of them also work in agriculture. Carlos lives in Lagunas settlement in Mórrope District in Lambayeque Department. He has only electricity and gets water from an artesian well, as do all the families in the area who live under the same conditions. 

Carlos’ commercial activity is raising and selling pigs, goats and poultry. He raises the animals in corrals outside of his house and has had 17 years of experience in the business. This has enabled him to maintain an established customer base. He sells his livestock to wholesale traders in the area. In addition, his wife sells “chicha de jora” [a beverage made from fermented corn] which generates additional income.

Currently Carlos has proposed expanding his inventory with respect to raising and selling animals because this is a very profitable activity in the area, which is why he is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a new loan in the amount of S/. 4,000 to buy nutritionally balanced feed, repair his corrals and purchase “arroz en verde” [a specific variety of rice], taking advantage of the end of the rice campaign, which in time will allow him to continue improving his standard of living.

loans.use:
to purchase animal feed, repair his corrals and purchase "arroz en verde"
(a specific variety of rice).

loans.name: Fatima Amalia

texts.es: Fatima vive en Guayaquil, tiene 45. Tiene dos hijos que asisten a la escuela fiscal. No es casada pero vive con el padre de sus hijos quien es mecánico. Comenzó ayudando a vender a otra persona, conforme aprendió el negocio se independizo. Desde hace 6 años vende productos de cosméticos a sus familiares, amigos y conocidos. Su horario de trabajo inicia a las 9 de la mañana hasta la noche. Como cualquier persona tiene dificultades con respecto a la delincuencia y las enfermedades. El préstamo lo va a utilizar para adquirir ropa, calzado, productos de belleza. Desea en un futuro mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo que se encuentra deteriorado y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fatima lives in Guayaquil and is 45 years of age. She has two children who attend a state school. Fatima is not married, but she lives with the father of her children. He has a job as a mechanic.

She started out working as an assistant for another saleswoman. This enabled her to learn the business before becoming independent. For the past six years, she has been selling cosmetics to her relatives, friends, and acquaintances. Her work schedule begins at 9am and continues until nightfall. Like any other person, Fatima has difficulties dealing with crime and illnesses.

Her loan will be used to acquire clothing, shoes, and beauty products. In the future, she wants to improve her home by replacing the roof that has deteriorated. She also wants to support her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and beauty products.

loans.name: San Martin De Zurite Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “San Martin de Zurite” en el distrito del Zurite de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por quince  personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; crianza de animales menores, venta de leche, venta de abarrotes, venta de verduras, venta de granos, venta de leña, venta de cuyes, venta de golosinas, venta de chicha y otros brindan servicios como por ejemplo brindan servicios de transportes y educación. 

La socia Marcelina nació en la provincia de Anta y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la Marcelina es la ganadería y la agricultura y también se dedica  a la venta de leche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Marcelina requiere el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los ganados. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Communal Bank "San Martin de Zurite" in the District of Zurite in Anta Province, Department of Cusco. This Communal Bank consists of 15 members who view each moment as an opportunity to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to provide a better future for their children. The business activities of the members are as follows: raising small animals, selling milk, selling groceries, selling vegetables, selling grains, selling wool, selling guinea pigs, selling candy, selling "chicha" (a beverage made from corn), and providing other services such as transportation and education.

Marcelina is a member who as born in Anta Province and still lives there. She is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Her main business activities are raising cattle and farming. She also sells milk. Marcelina has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy feed for her cattle.

In general, the members are grateful for this opportunity being given to them. They promise to complete the payment of their respective loans according to the established terms.

Cusco is located in the Distrct and Province of Cusco in the Department of Cusco. The heart of this ancient city of the Incas is where many archaeological sites are located. The historical center and the landscapes help make Cusco the most enchanting city in the southern region of Peru. Cusco is known for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel   es un hombre que tiene  42 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente, además  cuenta con 02 hijo que es menor de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Manuel vive en  el  distrito de Cayalti del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, agua y desagüe; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 850 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Manuel  es la  venta cajas de atún muy conocido en la zona por dedicarse a esta actividad., esta pequeña negocio la tiene instalada en su  domicilio , donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidel izados; así mismo su cónyuge también esta dedicada a la  crianza de aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  Manuel  cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este  negocio.  
Actualmente Manuel se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial y a la crianza de animales menores, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 2000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de mercadería (cajas de atún);  lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old, he is married by common law, and he has two children that are minors and live with him and his spouse in their home.  His community is considered one of subsistence living, as the majority of the residents are independent workers that breed and sell livestock, while others are involved in agriculture. Manuel lives in the district of Cayalti in the department of Lambayeque where his home has only basic electricity, water and plumbing. Over 850 families live in this area in similarly poor living conditions.

Manuel is well-known in his region because of his business of selling boxes of tuna.  He runs his small business from his home where he attends to his customers.  At the same time, his spouse also works from home by raising poultry in pens in the yard.  It is important to note that Manuel has over 4 years of experience in this activity as well, which has helped him to maintain his customer base and establish himself in his business.

Manuel has proposed to expand his inventory in both his business and in the breeding of small animals, because this is a very profitable activity in his region.  To accomplish this, he is seeking a loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles which will be used to invest in merchandise (boxes of tuna), which in time will enable him to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Chiltoma Group

texts.es:
El grupo Chiltoma está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Elena quien vende derivados del maíz como nacatamales, tamales, yoitamal…etc. El crédito lo invertirá en ingredientes maíz, cerdo, especies, leña…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Consuelo quien vende cerdo y almidón e invertirá en yuca, agua, aceite, mano de obra; y Veronica vende nacatamales, comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo.
texts.en:
The Chiltoma group is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial people.  One of them is María Elena, who sells corn-based foods like nacatamales, tamales, yoltamal... etc. (traditional Honduran specialties made of cornmeal with spices and meats steamed in corn husks or palm leaves).  This loan will be invested in ingredients, corn, pork, spices, firewood... etc.

The other members are Consuelo, who sells pork and starch and will invest in yucca, water, oil, and labor; and Veronica, who sells nacatamales, a traditional food whose principal ingredients are corn and pork.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like corn, pork, spices, firewood... etc. to create nacatamales, a traditional dish.

loans.name: Latré Kayissan

texts.fr:
Latré est une femme âgé(e) de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un électricien bâtiment et a 03 enfants tous à l’école. Le premier a 15ans et le dernier 10ans.
Latré travaille comme revendeuse de charbon de bois depuis 1994. Elle vend à toutes personnes à domicile et de façon ambulante. Sa difficulté est l’approvisionnement en saison pluvieuse.
Latré a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des charbons de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité la diversifier et assurer le bien –être de la famille.
texts.en:
Latré is a 42-year-old woman.  She is married to an electrical contractor and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Her oldest child is 15 years old, the youngest is 10.

Latré has been reselling charcoal since 1994.  She sells to everyone, from her home, and also as an itinerant seller.  Her biggest challenge is to get supplies during the rainy season.

Latré has requested her first loan from WAGES for the purchase of charcoal.  She wants to reinvest in the activity, diversify her business, and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: La señora Rosa se acerco a la institución  buscando apoyo para realizar algunos proyectos de mejoramiento de vivienda, nos  comenta  que  hace  poco y  con mucho esfuerzo   adquirió  su  vivienda  es por ello que   su  mayor  sueño es acondicionarla ,en esta ocasión requiere  colocar  el  vitrosipiso  en  la  sala  y  cocina  de  su  domicilio, agradece   el  apoyo  brindado  ya que  ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de ofrecer  a su  familia  una  mejor  calidad  de   vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa came to Credituyo seeking assistance so that she could complete a few home improvement projects. She says that she recently acquired her home with great effort. Her greatest dream is to remodel it, so on this occasion she needs to install floor tiles in the living room and kitchen of her house.

Rosa is grateful for the support that has been provided. She believes this loan makes it possible for her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to install floor tiles in her home.

loans.name: Marìa Gladys

texts.es:
María  es una mujer que tiene 53  años de edad, de estado civil casado, con 1 hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. María vive en  el caserío Latina del distrito y departamento de Lambayeque, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica María es la crianza/venta de ganado porcino ,caprinos  y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad María cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo también esta implementando una pequeña bodega  donde le permite tener otros ingresos. 
Actualmente María se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.800 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceado, arreglo de corrales y compra de abarrotes, y balones de gas ; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old, she is married and has one dependent child that lives at home with her and her spouse. The community in which she lives is considered subsistence living, as the majority of residents are independent workers that breed and sell livestock, while others are involved in agriculture.  Maria lives in the village of Latina in the district and department of Lambayeque, where she only has basic electric and water services (the water comes from the local well).  All the other families in this community live in these poor conditions as well.

Maria raises and sells pigs, goats and poultry.  She breeds the animals in pens outside of her home.  It's important to note that Maria has 4 years of experience in these activities, which has enabled her to maintain a good customer base and has helped her establish her business.  She sells these animals to wholesalers in the region.  She has also started a small store from which she can earn additional income.

Maria wants to increase her inventory for the raising and selling of her animals, which is a very profitable activity in the region.  She is asking for a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 800 nuevos soles which will be used to purchase food, animal pens, groceries and gas tanks, which in time will help her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy food for animal feeding pens and to buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Carlos Leonel

texts.es:
Carlos   es un hombre que tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Carlos  vive en  el caserío Monte Verde Bajo del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura, así mismo no cuenta con los servicios básicos de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal. Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad que desarrolla a la que se dedica Carlos es la agricultura pues tiene 0.75 ha. De terreno agrícola que su padre le ha dado como herencia, en el cual tiene sembrado cultivo de limón y papaya que presenta buen crecimiento vegetativo, donde cosecha semanalmente y luego lo comercializa en el mercado local de la zona, esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace 10 años que le ha permitido tener  de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Así mismo su cónyuge se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y le apoya en las actividades que realiza, es decir existe una buena relación familiar.
Actualmente Carlos se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la venta de su producción cosechado ,esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de Foliares, bioestimulantes, y pago de jornales para su cultivo instalado; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is a man who is 39 years years old and lives together with his spouse and two children in his own home.  He notes that the quality of life in his community is at a subsistence level, the majority of residents are independent workers who are involved in commerce and raising of small domestic animals and some of them are also in agriculture.  Carlos lives in the neighborhood of Monte Verde Bajo in the Tambogrande district of the department of Piura, a place where one cannot find basic electrical power and the water consumed in the area is from one artisan well.  Equally, all the families who reside there live under these conditions.

The work activity which Carlos is aiming to grow is agricultural.  He has 0.75 hectares of agricultural lands that his father had given to him as an inheritance, where he has planted limes and papaya which show good growth of their vegetation and fruits, which he picks weekly and then sells in the local market of his neighborhood.  This is work he has done for 10 years and has given him a lot of experience, which has allowed him to maintain a clientele of established customers at his business.  His spouse also works and raises small animals and helps him in the work he does, which is to say that they have an excellent family relationship.

Currently, Carlos has proposed expanding his inventory in relation to his sales of harvested produce, an idea that is born of it being a very lucrative activity in his area.  It is because of these circumstances that he has chosen to ask for a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 Soles, which are intended to buy defoliants, biostimulants, and to pay day laborers for the set up and that in time will permit him to improve his lot in life.

loans.use: to buy defoliants, biostimulants, and for payment of day laborers for his agricultural lands.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. She has a butchery and has been in the business for two years now and gets a monthly income of 8,500 shillings. 


This will be her first loan with KADET Ltd.; she plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock (goats and sheep) to slaughter, and she will sell the meat. In the future she wants to buy a plot and put up her own business premises.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep to slaughter

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 32 years old, married to a farmer, and the mother of a one-year-old daughter. For the past 10 years she has been selling livestock drugs and supplements to a thriving market of farmers and institutions. Previously a farmer, this aggressive and focused woman is determined to one day open an agrovet and make an income of Kes 500,000.

Leah's two main business challenges are roads made impassible during heavy rains that limit customer access and insufficient funds to improve her business. She is therefore requesting a loan of Kes 100,000 to buy fertilizer and farm seeds worth Kes 20,000, and veterinary retail stock worth Kes 80,000 With the anticipated profits, Leah plans to open a veterinary school educating farmers about livestock. In the future, she looks forward to being the best and leading supplier of agricultural farm products in Nyeri region.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm seeds worth Kes 20,000, and veterinary retail stock worth Kes 80,000.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like uncooked rice, palm oil, onions, tomatoes, fish, etc., in large quantities in order to cook a larger quantity of rice and sauce for sale

loans.name: Silueta De Cristal Group

texts.es:
El grupo Silueta de Cristal lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es  Ivania del Socorro quien tiene un taller de calzado. Este negocio lo tiene junto a su esposo quien es el que se encarga de la  elaboración del calzado mientras ella lo comercializa en Managua, León, y Rivas. El crédito lo invertirá  en charol, azulón pega, plantilla suelas, alistadores…etc.
Los otros integrantes son  Ivania quien elabora pozol, tiste y verduras y Juan de Dios quien tiene un taller de calzado desde hace 7 años.
texts.en:
The group "Silueta de Cristal" is made up of three hardworking people, and one of them is Ivania del Socorro who has a cobbler's shop.  This shop is co-owned by her and her husband who makes the shoes while she sells them in Managua, León, and Rivas. Her loan will be invested in patent leather, waterproof glue, sole templates, crimpers... etc.

The other members are Ivania, who makes pozol (a corn drink), tiste (a drink made of corn and cacao), and vegetables and Juan de Dios who has owned a cobbler's shop for the past 7 years.

loans.use: to buy patent leather, glue, dye, insoles, soles, lasting, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Buluk, South Sudan. She runs a food stall and has been in business for four years. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC and she has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale

loans.name: Luz Edita

texts.es:
Luz, tiene 37 años nació y vive Duran, su esposo   Fredi  es comerciante,
Comenzó la venta de ropa y artículos de ocasión  para darles a sus hijos una mejor oportunidad de estudio y alimentación.  Esta actividad la realiza junto a su  hija mayor, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a sábados.  
Los hijos de Luz asisten a la escuela fiscal de por su casa. Su mayor  temor son los ladrones dado que  si le llegaran a robar ella se quedaría sin material de trabajo y no podría ayudar a su esposo con las deudas y gastos de  su familia.
Utilizara el dinero del préstamo para incrementar su inventario comprando: Ropa de hombre, Ropa de mujer y artículos varios, Su sueño es poder crear su propio negocio y poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luz is 37 years old and was born in Duran, which is where she still lives. Her husband Fredi is a merchant. She began selling clothing and seasonal goods so that she could feed her children and provide them better educational opportunities. Luz and her oldest daughter work together in her business. Her work schedule is from Monday to Saturday. Her children attend the state school near her home.

Luz says her greatest fear is dealing with thieves because a robbery would leave her without any merchandise, so she would not be able to help her husband with the debts and the family expenses. She will use the money from this loan to increase her inventory. Luz plans to buy men's clothing, women's clothing, and various items. Her dream is to establish her business and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing and seasonal goods.

loans.name: Fight Against Shame Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Fight Against Shame” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for a loan of 600,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) each to invest in their respective businesses. 

Kadiatu is the leader of this group. She is fifty years old and married with four children – three who are no longer attending school and one who is in college. Kadiatu sells market food such as tomatoes, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, pepper, salt, flour, beans and oil. She has been a businesswoman for the past eighteen years. With the help of this loan, Kadiatu will invest in her business by buying food in bulk to expand her business. 

(Also included in the left of the photo is loan officer Rosaline handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, margi, onions, pepper, salt, flour, beans, oil and other foods in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Zahra's Group

texts.en:
Zahra is a 24-year-old married woman. She and her husband have four sons. All of her sons are young and don’t go to school.

Zahra and her husband are very cooperative with each other. They are involved in a sewing business. She sews ladies' clothes on order while her husband sews gents' clothes on order. In this way, they collect good orders from their customers and earn a good income after completing the orders on time. 

Zahra is relatively new to the sewing business, while her husband has been operating this business for more than 5 years. In these years, he has obtained a good reputation among his clients.  

Zahra has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s sewing business. He will use the loan to buy a new sewing machine and will hire an assistant to receive more orders and boost the earning profits of the business.

Zahra is very confident that their business will be improved a lot with the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is 28 years old; a married woman who has been residing together with her spouse and two lovely young kids in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Chan and her spouse help each other to manage a rice farming business as well as a vegetable growing business to raise the family. She usually sells her vegetables for profit in a local market after harvesting. Chan has been doing this business for many years.

Chan has encountered difficulties in living especially in this rainy season because there are gaps on her thatched roof, which allow the drops of the rain to come into her house. She wants to replace her roof with tiles and make it comfortable for her family. So now, she would like to take out a loan from HKL to purchase tiles to re-cover her roof. In the future, she plans to save money to reconstruct her house and make it stronger.

loans.use: to purchase tiles to re-cover her roof.

loans.name: Rickson

texts.en: Rickson is taking out another loan of Ksh 50000 to service his passenger vehicle. He plans to buy some spare parts for the vehicle. Rickson dreams of opening another shop in future. Since the previous loan, he can pay school fees for his children without any burden. Rickson thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy some spare parts for a vehicle.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a 23-year-old married man with a single child. He has been operating a grocery for the past 12 months, and his goal is to open a kiosk in the near future. He sells his goods at the market and he narrates that he faces a challenge of scarcity of goods during the dry season especially vegetable. Benson owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With the loan of Ksh 20000, he plans to purchase fruits and vegetables for sell.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a food vendor. She cooks rice and fish stew for sale at Ankyerenyin, near Takoradi. Faustina is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a teacher. She has been in this business for 6 years now. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding their children. 

Faustina will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook and sell. With the profits, Faustina plans to build a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook and sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a forty-five-year-old married man. He has four children ranging in ages from three years to twenty-five years. He describes himself as determined and creative. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, salt, flour, ropes, Blue Band (a brand of margarine) and painkillers. He has been involved in this business for five years. 

In addition, David increases his income by engaging himself in dairy farming where he sells milk. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving the business. 

He will use the loan of 30,000 KES to buy items such as sugar, flour, eggs, etc. Earlier on, he had requested a loan of 20,000 KES and managed to repay the whole amount. His business goal is to run a wholesale retail shop within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will use the anticipated profits to buy a plot of land on which he will build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Renson

texts.en:
Renson is taking out another loan to start a poultry business. He plans to use this loan of 60,000 KES to buy chicks and to renovate his poultry house. 

Renson dreams of establishing another poultry house to expand his business. He says that, since his previous loan, his monthly income has increased and the family’s living standards have improved.

loans.use: to buy chicks and to renovate his poultry house.

loans.name: Roger Aureliano

texts.es:
Roger   es un hombre que tiene  35 años de edad, de estado civil  soltero,  vive con sus padres en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Roger vive en  el  distrito de Cayalti del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, agua y desagüe; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 850 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Roger  es la  venta de piqueos y cerveza y es  muy conocido en la zona por dedicarse a esta actividad., esta pequeña negocio la tiene instalada en su  domicilio, donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidel izados; así mismo sus padres le apoyan en este negocio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  Roger  cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este  negocio.  
Actualmente Roger se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la  de compra de una congeladora, cerveza, gaseosas;  lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Roger is 35 years old, single and living at home with his parents.  The quality of life in his community is based on subsistance.  The majority of its inhabitants are independent workers who work in commerce and raising small animals.  Some of them work in agriculture additionally.
