Rachael used to sell cooked beans and gari but now, for 2 years, she has been selling clothing like jeans and men & ladies underwear.   She uses her income to support hre husband to feed and cloth their children.  Rachael will use her loan to purchase more jeans, ladies and men underware to sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business, Rachael wishes to acquire a shop to sell her goods.

loans.use: purchase more jeans, ladies and men's underwear to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives together with her husband, who is a driver, and their three children at Ankyerenyin near Takoradi. 

Rose is a petty trader. She sells food items such us tinned tomatoes, salt, powdered pepper, macaroni and other things.  This she has done for four years now. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Rose will use her loan to purchase more food items to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Agenes

texts.en: Agenes is a food vendor.  She sells maize porridge and fried doughnuts in addition to bread to her customers. Agenes  has been in this business for 13 years now.  Agnes is married and has four children. She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her doughnuts, bread, and porridge to sell. With the new profit, Agenes  will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her doughnuts, bread, and  porridge to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice sells palm kernel oil at Ankyernyin near Takoradi. This she has done for 10 years. Eunice is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children's school fees. Eunice will use her loan to purchase gallons of palm kernel oil to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of palm kernel oil to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 55-year-old widowed woman with five children who finished school. She lives in her own house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical bills. 

Mwanasha has operated a general store for the past five years, selling to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high prices of commodities. She aspires to start a wholesale business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase additional stock of sugar, beans, flour, and peas for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of sugar, maize flour, and beans for her shop.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida sells cloth and dresses at Akyerenyin near Takoradi. She has been in this business for three years. She is married and has two children. She uses her income to support her husband in the general up-keep of their family. Vida will use her loan to purchase cloth and dresses to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en: Elizerbeth is a hairdresser at Anyerenyin near Takoradi.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a welder. Elizerbeth has been a hairdresser for five years.  She uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills.  Her loan will be used to purchase hair creams, hair extensions, and a hair dryer for her work. She hopes to use the new profits to open a beauty salon to make her work easy.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams, hair extensions, and a hair dryer for her work.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia operates a grocery shop at Ankyernyin near Takoradi. This she has done for 10  years. The items in her grocery shop are tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, and powdered milk. She is married with four children. Cecilia uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Cecilia plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a married man with two children, who both attend school. He operates a 14-seater passenger vehicle and has been operating this vehicle for the last three years. Theft of some parts of his vehicle is a major challenge to him, and he dreams of buying a bus in future. Kennedy has rented a house that has both electricity and piped water. He says food and rent are his greatest monthly expenses. He plans to service his vehicle using the KES 50,000 loan.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 35-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are enrolled in school. She lives in her own house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Fatuma has operated a motorcycle business for the past three years. She has employed a driver to operate the motorcycle, which carries her neighbors around at a fee as they run their errands. She faces a major challenge of competition. She aspires to start a kiosk in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase fuel (diesel) to sell to motorcyclists in the neighborhood. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase some stock of fuel (diesel) to sell.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah operates a grocery shop at Ankyernyin near Takoradi. This she has done for 10 years. The items in her grocery shop are tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc.  She is married and has four children. Hannah uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Hannah plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 32 years old, married and blessed with a three-year-old child. 

To earn a living, he does tailoring. He has employed one person to assist him in his tasks. He has improved his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.

Gabriel hopes to expand his business in the future. He needs 100,000 KES to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe is a married man with three children, all enrolled in school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Food and school fees are his greatest monthly expenses.

He operates a passenger vehicle. He says the high cost of fuel is his major challenge, and he dreams of buying a lorry in the future. 

Swalehe joined Yehu to get financial support for his business. With the KES 50,000, he intends to service the vehicle.

loans.use: to service the vehicle.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, he has been a carpenter making furniture that he sells to his customers from home. He faces a major challenge of high competition as there are several carpenters in the area. He dreams of starting a wood workshop where he can sell timber in bulk.

With the KES 30,000, he wants to purchase timber and nails. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift his living standards.

loans.use: To buy timber and nails for his furniture business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
As a former soldier in the Canadian Army, Robert, 45, wanted to use his training and experience to serve others in the community and opened Specialized Security Group three years ago. The private security company caters to individuals or groups who need security. 

What separates his security company from others within the San Antonio and Selma areas is that Robert only hires military veterans and pays better than 99 percent of other security companies. “We offer better services at a better rate,” Robert said.

Regularly, Robert employs 10 other security officers per job, but he said he has about 50 on stand-by. If he lands the next two contracts, Robert said he will be able to hire more officers.

One of Robert’s partners informed him about ACCION Texas Inc., which influenced him to obtain a loan from ACCION rather than a traditional bank.

The loan helped tremendously, Robert said. It paid for insurance, licensing and uniforms. 

Robert is a father of two children who financially depend on him. “I appreciate ACCION,” he said. “Without it a lot of people would be suffering.”

To find out more about his business, visit his website at: www.specializedsecuritygroup.com.

loans.use: The loan paid for licencing, uniforms and insurance.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. He is a retailer who runs a general store where he sells household groceries such as flour, soap, salt, etc. The business has been in operation for the last five years. Hamisi is also a fisherman. He obtained the capital for the current business from the savings made from the fishing he did previously.

Hamisi joined Milango to access credit for his business. He is applying for a loan of 83,450 KES to purchase retail stock such as flour, cooking fat, soaps and cereals for sale.
 
He looks forward to being able to cater to his family's needs from the extra income from this loan.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock such as flour, cooking fat, soaps and cereals for sale.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati has three children and all of his children are enrolled in school. Bahati lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

He operates a graphics shop where he does printing and typing. He has been in this business for the last 14 years. Other sources of income include sales from farm produce.  

He aspires to open a photo studio in the future. He joined Yehu to access some funds to boost his business. With the KES 50,000, he plans to purchase a printer and a typewriter.

loans.use: to purchase a printer and a typewriter.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 53-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 1 year to 17 years. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a farm where he sells tomatoes. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a densely populated area and his primary customers are residents. 

He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for building a bigger greenhouse for the tomatoes. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy chemicals, fertilizers and seeds. 

His business goal is to own many greenhouses growing different types of crops within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the profits  generated to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, chemicals and seeds.

loans.name: Barrio Nuevo Huictepec Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama barrio nuevo huixtepec las personas que lo conforman decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así se llama su comunidad, ya que todos pertenecen a la misma, la historia es acerca de la señora aurea quien cuenta con 61 años de edad y es madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales ya todos están casados, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan desde hace más de 20 años.

Ella decidió iniciar con este negocio porque su mama se dedicaba a esta actividad y fue ella quien le enseño, también porque quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de más material como son: huevos, manteca, azúcar, harina, levadura, canela, etc. Y así continuar elaborando su rico pan.

Doña aurea está muy contenta porque dice que le esta yendo muy bien con su negocio, ya que sus ventas han incrementado bastante al igual que sus clientes e ingresos, tanto que hasta está ahorrando para asegurar su futuro económico.

La meta que tiene para su negocio es la de continuar invirtiéndole ya que quiere hacer crecer mucho mas, está pensando en construir otro horno para agilizar y contar con una ágil producción y así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatatarios de kiva por el apoyo incondicional que le están brindando, ya que gracias a esta ayuda ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Estos son los nombres de las personas y las actividades a las que se dedican cada una de las integrantes del grupo.
Ofelia, victoriana, aurea, Cecilia y eulogia quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: abarrotes, venta de comida, bordados, y panadería.
texts.en:
This group is named Barrio Nuevo Huixtepec.   The members decided to give it this name because it is the name of their community, of which all of them are members.

The story is about Aurea, age 61.  She is a single mother of six children, who are now all married.  She has devoted herself to making and selling bread for over 20 years.  She decided to start with this business because her mother devoted herself to this business activity.  Her mother was the one who taught her.

Also, she wanted to look for a way to get her children ahead and improve her family’s quality of life.  She will use the loan she received to buy more ingredients like eggs, lard, sugar, flour, yeast, and cinnamon, etc.  This way she will continue making her delicious bread.

Aurea says she is very happy because her business is going very well for her.  Her sales have increased quite a lot as well as her customers and income.  They have increased so much that she is even saving in order to assure her financial future.

The goal that she has for her business is to continue investing because she wants to make it grow more.  She is thinking of building another oven in order to accelerate her production and to make it easier.  This way she will improve and increase her income.

She is very grateful to the Fundación Realidad and the Kiva lenders for the whole-hearted support they are giving her.  Thanks to this help she has improved her quality of life and that of her family.

These are the names of the people and the business activities of the members of the group.  Ofelia, Victoriana, Aurea, Cecilia, and Eulogia devote themselves to different business activities like groceries, selling food, embroidery, and a bakery.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like eggs, lard, sugar, flour, yeast, and cinnamon, etc.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man with four children, one of whom attends school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, he has operated a grocery business where he sells most of the vegetables at the market. He faces a major challenge of high competition. He dreams of starting a kiosk.

With the KES 30,000 he wants to purchase cabbages, tomatoes and kale for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, kale and cabbages for his grocery business.

loans.name: Adiviadji

texts.fr:
Adiviadji est une femme âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un étudiant et à 02 enfant de 04 et 02ans.
Adiviadji travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2006. Elle vend dans une boutique  et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES. Ce prêt l'aidera à acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. 
 Adiviadji veut réinvestir dans l’activité, la développer et assurer la santé de ses enfants par l'achat des médicaments en cas de besoin.
texts.en:
Adiviadji is a 35-year-old woman. She is married to a student and has two children, who are 2 and 4 years old. She has been working as a grocer since 2006. She sells out of a store and gets her supplies in Lomé. She is on her second loan with WAGES. This loan will help her to buy grocery items. 

Adiviadji wants to reinvest in her business, develop it, and ensure that her children's health care needs are met by purchasing medicine.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 42-year-old conservative woman, so she asked one of her sons to take her place in the photo.

After taking out her first loan, Fatmeh has decided to concentrate on selling milk and cheese, leaving the farming work to her husband. Recently Fatmeh has started animal sales business beside making dairy products. 

Now Fatmeh has applied foir this loan in order to buy more sheep to increase their revenue.

loans.use: to buy more sheep to increase their revenue

loans.name: Jira

texts.en: Jira is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. He is married and runs a transport business; owning a motorcycle on which he ferries people and goods within Malindi town. Jira is applying for a loan of 21,050 KES to purchase spare parts for the repair of his motorcycle. The additional income will form part of his savings. The main challenge in the business is high cost of fuel.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the repair of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is married with two children. He lives in Likoni, Kenya. For the past three years, Mark has run a grocery shop where he sells fruits, vegetables, cereals, and other items. He got the capital to start his business from selling brooms and coconuts. Mark learned of Milango from his friends and he joined to access credit.

Mark is requesting a 41,900 KES loan to purchase crates of tomatoes, potatoes, and other greens. The extra income from his loan will help Mark pay for his children’s school fees. His ambition is to purchase the greens directly from the farmers and sell to his customers. He also hopes to increase the number of outlets.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, and other greens

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal, 51 years old and widowed, still has five sons and a daughter who are not married and living with her.

Nawal used to make embroidery items for her house, and after her husband passed away, she decided to use her hobby to make money, so she started to make more embroidered pillow covers, hangings, etc., all by hand, and participated in a few traditional festivals and exhibitions to sell her work.

Now Nawal has applied for this loan to buy a sewing machine that will help her accelerate the business and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is married and the mother of two children. She is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. For the past three years, Jackline has run a grocery stall. She learned of Milango from a company employee and joined to access credit for her business.

Jackline is requesting a 15,900 KES loan to purchase additional stock of groceries and vegetables such as potatoes, fruits, vegetables, and other items. Despite the challenges of high taxes and a seasonal business climate, Jackline believes she will be able to educate her children using the extra income from her loan. Her future ambition is to open another grocery stall.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, fruits, vegetables, and groceries to sell

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam, 32 years old and a married woman, has one daughter and one son. Her husband works in the plumbing business.

To help her husband improve their living conditions, Ibtisam also started to work at home in a retail business selling blankets and bed covers. She has applied for this loan to bring in more types of bed covers and sheets.

loans.use: to bring in more types of bed covers and sheets.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a welder living in Malindi, Kenya. He is a married father of three children and has been in this business for 5 years. He got the capital from relatives to start the business. 

He is applying for a loan of 26,300 Kenya shillings to purchase a welding machine. Samson is focused on marketing his business to be known in the area. He believes the additional income from this business will enable him educate his children. The challenge facing the business is some clients not paying on time.

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fish.

loans.name: Chacha

texts.en:
Chacha is single and lives in Likoni, Kenya. For the past year, he has been running a charcoal business. Chacha started his business with less than three bags of charcoal. He sold smaller, one kilogram units of charcoal to his clients and his business has continued to grow and with growing demand. Chacha joined Milango to access credit. His main business challenge is the seasonal business climate and high cost of transportation.

Chacha is requesting a 83,450 KES loan to purchase additional stock of charcoal. The extra income will help Chacha pay for his children’s school fees. His ambition is to purchase a truck to transport the charcoal directly from the sellers to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She has two school-going children, ages 3 and 8 years old. Getrude runs a secondhand clothes business which has been running for 7 years.  This business is the only source of livelihood to her family.

The need for capital to expand her business operations led her to join Milango. She has applied for a loan of 21,050 KES to purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes. Getrude believes that this will help improve the standard of living of her family and also provide good education. She aspires to open up a salon in the future, despite the challenges of high cost of transport and seasonal business climate.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a resident of Malindi, Kenya and is a clothes shop owner. The shop has been running for 4 years. She is a married mother of 2 children. She started the business from her husband’s salary.

On learning about Milango from her friends, Getrude joined the group members to access loans. She is therefore applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings to buy a new stock of dresses, hair clips and trousers. She believes the additional income from this loan will help her pay for her children’s school fees. Her ambition is to be an established boutique owner in the region, despite the challenges of seasonal business climate and inflation.

loans.use: To buy a new stock of dresses, hair clips and trousers.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence runs a butchery in Malindi, Kenya, where she lives. She has been running her business for four years and sells poultry and cattle meat. She is a single mother and has one school-going child. Her business provides the only source of livelihood for her family. Florence learned about Milango from her friends and joined to access credit for her business needs.

She is applying for a loan of 21,100 to buy a freezer in which to store the meat she offers for sale. The challenges currently facing the business are the high cost of transportation and price fluctuations.

Her ambition is to own a large business in the area in future. Through the profits from this business, Florence believes she will be able to offer her child a good education and provide for her other basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a freezer in which to store the meat she offers for sale

loans.name: Ghaleb

texts.en:
Ghaleb, 57 years old and a married man, is supporting a family of seven members. After his retirement, he opened a small food market in front of his house to continue having an income, and recently he added selling items other than food products. 

Now Ghaleb has applied to this loan to add more products to have variety in the store. He hopes that he can add selling fruits and vegetables in the future.

loans.use: to add more products

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 37 years old and a married man, has one child. His wife is a teacher, when he works in a fruit and vegetables store.

Mohammad has started a small retail business after his work, selling clothes. Now he wants to work on expanding his own business, and for that reason he has applied for a loan to buy more clothes from a free zone area and from a wholesale market.

loans.use: to buy more clothes from a free zone area

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is marred and the mother of three children. She lives in the coastal town of Likoni, Kenya. For the past two years, she has been running a shop where she sells charcoal. Benter started her business with her own capital, selling five bags of charcoal in front of a space next to someone's shop. She currently has her own shop and now can sell up to 100 bags at certain times. Benter's ambition is to expand her business and she joined Milango to access extra credit. Her business challenges are the high cost of transportation and inflation.

Benter is requesting a 21,050 KES loan to purchase 100 bags of charcoal. The additional income from her loan will go towards her children’s education and to provide family savings for any emergency. Benter aspires to be a wholesale supplier of charcoal to other retailers in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is married with four children, one of whom is in school. He is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. For over the past ten years, Wilson has been selling fruits and vegetables. He has also invested in the transportation industry and owns a motorcycle which transports people and goods within Malindi town. Wilson was introduced to Milango by his friends. His main business challenges are inflation and price fluctuations.

Wilson is requesting a 62,700 KES loan to purchase additional stock of onions, tomatoes, potatoes, avocadoes, and other items to sell at his market. He currently rents a market stall and his ambition is to build a permanent business premise. Wilson believes the income from his loan will help improve his family's living standard. He will also be able to purchase another motorcycle and believes that in future he can buy a three-wheeler, commonly referred to as a “tuk tuk.”

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, potatoes, and avocadoes

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr: Saye est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de quatre enfants dont les trois vont à l'école.Afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoins et d'appuyer son mari dans les dépenses d'entretien de la famille, elle exerce depuis un an, un commerce d'encens". Elle achète les intrants et prépare elle -même le produit avant de le vendre en détail aux femmes.Son encens est très prisé par les femmes ; ce qui lui vaut une bonne clientèle et des revenus assez importants.Elle parvient ainsi à se prendre en charge et à soutenir également son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Elle sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter des intrants qui entrent dans la composition de l'encens.
texts.en: Saye is a married woman. She is the mother of four children, of whom three go to school. To be able to support herself and help her husband in caring for the family, she has been running an incense business for a year. Saye purchases the ingredients and make the product herself. She then sells them retail to women. Her incenses are highly prized by women, thus earning her a good customer base and fairly significant revenues. And so she manages to support herself and also her husband in covering family expenses. Saye is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy the ingredients for making incense.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients for making incense

loans.name: Pacificah

texts.en:
Pacificah runs a retail shop in Malindi, Kenya. She is the married mother of three school-going children. Her shop has been in operation for the last 10 years. Pacificah was introduced to Milango by an employee of the organization and joined to access credit. 

She is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings in order to add stock to her store, such as milk, flour, sugar, and cereals. The main challenges facing her business are price fluctuations and high transportation costs incurred while bringing the stock to her shop. Nevertheless, Pacificah believes that the additional income from this loan will help her provide for the education of her children as well as to supply for her family’s other basic needs. 

She aspires to own a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to add stock to her store, such as milk, flour, sugar, and cereals

loans.name: Indomables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INDOMABLES” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Tejada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Tatiana es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de productos de belleza, venta de tienda de barrio, venta de calzados, venta de productos Herbalife, venta de condimentos, venta de verduras.

La señora Tatiana, indica que  es el primer ciclo que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hija. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su amiga.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar de mercadería de su negocio (compra de víveres), mismo que comprará de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyarse ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene una hija.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de grupo.
texts.en: The group known as the "Indomables", or the indomitable ones, will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer.  This group has 6 members and is led by a committee.  Tatiana is the president.  The members each have different businesses, including beauty products, a general store, shoe sales, herbal supplements and vegetables.  Tatiana has a shop she has run in the neighborhood for many years, a business she learned from her friend.  Tatiana's daughter invited her to join the communal bank.    Her portion of the loan will be used to purchase inventory to stock her small store.   She shops at the large markets in the city of El Alto, and later sells the inventory at her small neighborhood store.   This business helps her to support her family.   When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Tatiana said that she likes the group meetings.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Juana Norma

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria de telica, es maestra  de primaria y está ubicada  en el colegio de una  comarca de la localidad, tiene 19 años de laborar, su núcleo familiar  consta de 3 personas que son sus hijos, los cuales están casados, esta señora solicito su tercer financiamiento atraves del convenio con el mismo colegio, los mismos le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, ya que este ultimo lo utilizara para la compra de cemento, Arena, Ayudante  y mano de obra. para repellar  su casa y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, con ese objetivo se acerco a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento y poder realizar la obra que tanto necesita, para seguir mejorando y desarrollando su familia.
texts.en: Juana Norma is originally from Telica.  She has been a teaching first graders at nearby school for 19 years.  Juana Norma has 3 children, all married now.  She is requesting her third loan through a program at the school.  These loans have helped Juana to improve her quality of life, and with this loan she will be able to purchase materials necessary to repair her home, as well as pay for some of the labor.   She is working with Ceprodel to secure this credit so that she can do the needed work and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair her home, such as cement, sand, as well as help with the labor.

loans.name: Hector Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben es un hombre muy trabajador, vive al lado de su esposa y de su pequeño hijo de 8 años de edad, el cual es su adoración y por el cual lucha cada día para darle una buena calidad de vida, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, así como también por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz y también por los riquísimos camarones. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio, asimismo le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Arroz chaufa.

Con mucho entusiasmo Ruben trabaja día a día en su negocio como maestro constructor, él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 5 clientes de manera diaria, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo tiene buenos acabados.

Ruben está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar madera para su negocio y realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia; así el podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y una buena calidad a su familia”.
texts.en: Ruben is a very hard worker.  He lives with his wife and their 8 year old son.  Ruben adores his son and it is for him that he works so hard every day to improve their quality of life.  Their home is located in the city of Camana, a place known for its beautiful beaches and delicious shrimp, as well as for the cultivation of rice.    When Ruben has free time, he likes to play football with his friends and neighbors in the neighborhood.  They also like to get together and share a delicious plate of Arroz chaufa, a rice and seafood dish.   Ruben works with great enthusiasm every day as a talented builder.  Working 10 hours a day, he can attend to as many as 5 customers a day.   He believes the reason that his business is going well is because he's very responsible and has many successful projects completed.   Ruben is very grateful to the Kiva loans.  Thanks to the support, he can purchase wood for his business as well as some to repair his own home.   This will enable him to increase his income, as well as improve the quality of life for his family.   Ruben wants to continue fighting hard to realize his big dream, which is to provide a good education for his son and a good quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and repair his home.

loans.name: Ndèye Diakhou

texts.fr: Ndèye est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de deux enfants.Depuis un an, elle vend des cartes de recharge de crédit de téléphone.Elle s'approvisionne auprès des demi - grossistes et revend au détail à ses clients.Elle vend des cartes des trois opérateurs de téléphonie mobile de son pays; ce qui fait qu'elle parvient  à générer des bénéfices assez substantiels.Elle prend ainsi en charge ses propres besoins et certaines dépenses d'entretien des enfants. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter des cartes de recharge de crédit téléphone.
texts.en: Ndèye is a married woman and the mother of two children. For a year, she has been selling phone minutes recharge cards. She gets her supplies from middlemen and sells them retail to her customers. She sells cards from three mobile phone operators in her country. This means she manages to generate fairly substantial profits. And so she supports herself and covers certain childcare expenses.  To bolster her business capital, Ndèye is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy phone cards.

loans.use: to buy phone minutes

loans.name: Housron

texts.fr:
Housron est un homme âgé de 45 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et à 5 enfants dont 4 vont à l’école. Le premier a 22 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.
Housron travaille comme restaurateur depuis 1999. Il vend de la nourriture pour tous clients à la maison. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le manque d’argent pour la réfection de son restaurant et renforcer son stock.
Housron a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des condiments pour la restauration et effectuer la réfection de son restaurant. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Housron voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assurer le bien être de sa famille et l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Housron is a 45-year-old man. He is married to a retailer and has five children, of whom four go to school. The first child is 22, and the last is 2. Housron has been working as a restauranteur since 1999. He sells food to any customer at his house. He purchases goods in Lomé and works by himself. At the moment, his main difficulty is a lack of money for renovating his restaurant and bolstering his inventory. 

Housron has requested his first loan from WAGES for buying condiments for his restaurant and to carry out the renovation of it. He wants to reinvest in his business. 

In the next few years, Housron would like to expand his business. With the profits, he says he plans to ensure his family's well-being and his children's education.

loans.use: to buy condiments for food service and to do refurbishing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more poultry stock to bring into her farm

loans.name: Tuamaalo

texts.en:
Tuamaalo, age 49, owns and operates a small store where she sells such everyday items as soap, sugar, and flour. She has operated her business for two years. She and her husband have six children. 

Tuamaalo became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise to offer for sale in her store. She plans to use her profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona, age 61, has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for four years. She and her husband have four children.

Ramona has requested a loan in order to buy new farming tools and farming chemicals. She will also spend part of her loan to pay for her children's education. She has been a member of SBPD for three years. 

With her profits, Ramona hopes to start up another small business.

loans.use: to buy farming tools and chemicals for growing taro and bananas

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, age 33, owns and operates a small store, where she sells such everyday items as sugar, salt, and soap. She has been doing this for three years. She and her husband have seven children.

Joyce became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more items to offer for sale. She hopes to use her profits to help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Guadalupe Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guadalupe victoria esta integrado  por 5 mujeres que con su trabajo dan a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona cañera y la principal actividad economica es la siembra y el cultivo de la caña de azucar,sus integantes son: Imelda venta de antojitos, Georgina Venta de abarrotes , Selene venta de calzado, Blanca venta de lenceria y Abelina venta de calzado.

Doña Georgina es uno de los miembros de este grupo ella tiene la edad de 55 años, estudio la secundaria y esta casada con don Roque cone el cual tiene dos hijas, ella platica que siempre a tenido que trabajar para ayudar al gasto del hogar pero ella siempre habia querido tener su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes ya hace un poco mas de dos años con el apoyo de su esposo logro abrir su negocio el cual esta ubicado en su hogar ella acondiciono la parte de enfrente de su casa para ahí poner su tienda, La tienda de doña Georgina es una de las mas surtidas de la colonia lo cual le a ayudado a ganar muchos clientes ya que siempre van a encontrar lo que el cliente necesite. Ella esta muy contenta con su negocio ya que aparte del beneficio economico esta enseñando a sus hijas a trabajar ya que ellas la ayudad a atender a los clientes.

ella inevertira este credito en la compra de  aceite, comida enlatada, frijoles, arroz, refrescos, dulces, sabritas, pan dulce, galletas, sal , azucar , mayonesa, jabon y cloro pra resurtir su negocio.

ella quiere que esta inversion ayude a que su negocio continue pre¿ogresando y sus ganancias aumenten ya que le gustaria que sus hijas estudiaran la universidad.

Este grupo agradece a la fundacion el apoyo que se les ha brindado atravez de este prestamo.
texts.en:
The Guadalupe Victoria group is comprised of five women, who with their work give their families a better quality of life.  This group is in a located in a sugar cane area, and the main financial activity is planting and cultivating sugar cane.

The members of the group are:
Imelda:  Sells Mexi can snacks
Georgina:  Sells groceries
Selene:  Sells shoes
Blanca:  Sells lingere
Abelina:  Sells shoes

Georgina is one of the members of this group.  She is 55 years old, has a high school education,  and is married to Roque, with whom she has two daughters.  She says that she has always had to work to help with the household expenses.  

However, she had always wanted to have her own business selling groceries.  A little over two years ago, with her husband’s help, she managed to open her business.  The business is in her home.   It is in the front part of her house where she prepared a place to set up her store.

Georgina’s store is one of the best stocked stores in the neighborhood.   This has helped her to win over a lot of customers because they always find what they need.  She is very happy with her business.  Aside from the financial benefit, it is teaching her daughters to work because they help her tend to the customers.

She will use this loan to buy oil, canned foods, beans, rice, soft drinks, candy, Sabritas (a brand of snacks), sweet bread, cookies, salt, sugar, mayonnaise, soap, and bleach in order to restock her business.

She wants this investment to help her business continue making progress.  She also wants her income to increase because she would like her daughters to attend the university.

This group is grateful to the Fundación for the support it has provided through this loan.

loans.use: to buy oil, canned foods, beans, rice, soft drinks, candy, Sabritas (a brand of snacks), sweet bread, cookies, salt, sugar, mayonnaise, soap, and bleach.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, tiene 43 años pero el espíritu de una joven de 20, es madre de 2 hijos, ambos tienen 20 años y son la adoración de Flor y por los cuales Flor da la vida por darles una vida feliz y con una buena calidad de vida; su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Santiago, Ica , Perú; El distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo en él se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros; asimismo se le conoce por la amabilidad de su gente. Cuando Flor tiene un tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión en especial las series de comedia; asimismo aprovecha la oportunidad en algunas ocasiones comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”.

Día a día flor trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y servicio de fotocopiado; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 50 clientes, ella cre que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismática con los clientes y sobre todo ofrece productos de calidad a precios cómodos.

Flor está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar la reparación de su máquina fotocopiadora, con lo cual mejorara sus ingresos y podrá mejor atención a sus clientes, así ella seguirá trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio”.
texts.en: Flor is a hard working and enthusiastic woman of 43 years, but she has the spirit of a young woman of 20.  Flor has two children whom she adores, both 20 years old now, and she dedicates her life to making them happy and providing a good quality of life.   Flor lives in the district of Santiago, Ica, in Peru.  This area is characterized by its warm and comfortable climate, as well agriculture, especially cotton, grapes, asparagus and paprika, to name just a few.  It's also known for its friendly people.   When Flor has free time, she enjoys watching television, especially comedy series.   She also enjoys one of her favorite dishes, rice and chicken.   Every day Flor works hard running her small general store, where she sells staple items as well as provides photocopying services.    During her 10 hour days, she has about 50 customers come through the store.   Flor believes her business is successful because she is very charismatic with her customers and always offers quality products at fair prices.   Flor is very grateful for the Kiva loans. With this support, she will be able to repair her photocopy machine, which helps her increase her income and provide better service to her customers.   Flor continues to work hard to realize her dream,  to have her own home.

loans.use: to repair her photocopier

loans.name: Palepa

texts.en:
Palepa, age 28, has a small plantation where she grows bananas to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for two years. 

Palepa has requested a loan to buy farming tools and to help pay for her children's education. She and her husband have three children.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Palepa hopes to  improve her home and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for growing bananas

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna  est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il exerce le métier de tailleur depuis bientôt dix ans.Il a ouvert dans sa ville un atelier de couture dans lequel il reçoit un grand nombre de clients.Saisissant les opportunités que lui offre le marché, avec la présence de nombreux tailleur dans les alentours, il a aménagé une partie de son atelier pour y vendre des articles de mercerie.Face à une demande devenue assez forte il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter des articles de mercerie divers.
texts.en: Sokhna is a married man, father of three children.He has worked as a tailor for nearly ten years.In his town he opened a sewing shop in which he receives a large number of clients.Seizing the opportunities offered to him by the circumstances of the market, in view of the presence of numerous tailors in the neighbourhood, he has fitted out part of his workshop to sell haberdashery goods.To meet the demand that has become quite strong he requests a loan of 200000f  to purchase various articles of haberdashery.

loans.use: to buy various articles of haberdashery.

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete, age 46, is a widow with five children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Pelenatete has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She needs a loan to buy tools, spices, and ingredients for preparing pork buns to offer for sale. She plans to use her profits to help fund her children's education.

loans.use: to buy tools, spices, and ingredients for her pork bun business

loans.name: Ikigazi Group

texts.fr:
Christine  fait partie du groupe Ikigazi  et habite à Rumonge commune sous la direction de la branche de Bujumbura. Elle a 52 ans et est mariée à Nasoro commerçant de manioc. Ensemble ils ont  5enfants, âgés de 15  à 35ans, dont 2 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 orphelins qui étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de manioc depuis 3 ans.

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup  de manioc  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Les gains du commerce lui permettront d’améliorer la ration alimentaire, supporter les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Christine is part of the group Ikigazi and lives in Rumonge Commune, under the direction of the Bujumbura branch. She is 52 years old and married to Nasoro, a cassava merchant. Together they have five children, from 15 to 35 years old. Two of the children are students. Christine has charge of two orphans, who are students. 

Christine has been selling cassava for three years.

This is her first loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and buy a lot of cassava to sell in order to earn more. 

The profit from her business will enable her to improve her food rations and to help with her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy a lot of cassava to resell in order to earn more

loans.name: Sesa

texts.en:
Sesa, age 54, owns and operates a business printing elei, a type of Samoan cloth. She has been in this line of business for a year. She and her husband have seven children. 

Sesa joined SPBD in 2011. She has requested a loan because she needs a loan to buy printing tools. She intends to use her profits to help her business grow.

loans.use: to buy paint brushes and other printing tools

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr: Arame est une femme mariée, mère de cinq enfants. Elle vend au marché de sa localité des vêtements et des articles pour femmes notamment des perles, de l'encens, des nuisettes...Elle achète sa marchandise en gros dans la capitale et la revend en détail à une clientèle qui lui est très fidèle. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille. Afin de renforcer son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite un pret de 250 000f auprès de l'UIMCEC pour acheter des perles, des pagnes et des articles divers.Elle ambitionne de devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Arame is a married woman and the mother of five children. At the market in her town, she sells clothing and women's items, particularly beads, incense, and lingerie….  She purchases her goods wholesale in the capital city and sells them retail to a customer base that is very loyal to her. The revenues derived from her business enable her to support herself and to help cover the costs of caring for her family. 

To bolster her stock of merchandise, she is  requesting a loan of 250,000 francs from the microfinance institution U-IMCEC to buy beads, pagnes (the colorful cloth of western Africa), and a variety of items. Her ambition is to become a wholesale merchant

loans.use: to buy beads, "pagne" cloth, and various items

loans.name: Puaaelo

texts.en: Puaaelo is a 49-year-old woman, who is married with seven children. She plans to start a small business, providing taxi services to customers.  Puaaelo needs a loan to purchase new tires for her taxi. She will use her profits to save and look for a good location to provide the service. Puaaelo joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To purchase new tires for her taxi

loans.name: Los Blanquillos Del Charco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama los blanquillos del charco los integrantes eligieron este nombre porque la comunidad donde viven se llama el charco y varios de ellos se dedican a la venta de pescados y blanquillos, esta historia es acerca del señor francisco ya que es el representante de este grupo, tiene 40 años de edad y está casado con la señora Rosalba, tiene 3 hijos  quienes cursan segundo año de prepa, uno más segundo año de secundaria y Adolfo cuarto año de primaria, el se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado desde hace 15 años.

Dice que decidió empezar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante y ofrecerles una mejor educación y calidad de vida y gozar de una buena solvencia económica, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en la compra de vacas, becerros y maíz.

La meta que se ha puesto don francisco es la de hacer crecer mucho más su negocio, estar invistiendo constantemente para ir haciendo crecer el número de animales y tener mejores ventas y producción, puesto que así mejorara e incrementara sus ingresos, para ofrecer un nivel de vida mejor a su familia.

Don chico (como mejor lo conocen en su comunidad) le da las gracias a FRAC y kiva por que gracias a ellos ha podido lograr hacer crecer poco a poco su negocio y así cambiar su vida y la de su familia.

Otros de los compañeros de don francisco son: Delfino, francisca y Leticia quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: venta de pescados y comercialización de ganado (compra y venta de vacas, becerros, etc.)
texts.en:
This group is named Los Blanquillos del Charco.  The members selected this name because the community where they live is called El Charco. Several of the members sell fish and eggs.

This story is about Francisco because he is the group representative.  He is 40 years old, married to Rosalba, and has three children.  One is in the second year of high school, one is in the second year of middle school, and Adolfo is in fourth grade.  

Francisco has been buying and selling livestock for 15 years.  He decided to start this business activity because he wanted to look for the way to get his children ahead.  He also wanted to give them a better education, to give them a better quality of life, and to enjoy good financial solvency.  He will use the loan he was given to buy cows, calves, and corn.

The goals that Francisco has set are to make his business grow a lot more, to constantly invest in order to increase the number of animals he has, and to have better sales and production.  This will improve and increase his income so that he can give his family a better standard of living.

Chico (as he is better known in his community) thanks FRAC and Kiva because it is thanks to them that he has been able to make his business grow little by little.  This changes his life and that of his family.

His colleagues are Delfino, Francisca, and Leticia.  They devote themselves to different activities like selling fish and marketing livestock (buying and selling cows and calves, etc.).

loans.use: to buy cows, calves, and corn.

loans.name: Fipe

texts.en: Fipe is 22 years old and married. She owns and operates a business venture printing "elei" (Samoan printed cloth) for making clothes. She has two years of experience in this line of business. Fipe needs a loan to purchase more tools for painting. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy paintbrushes and other printing tools

loans.name: Marième

texts.fr: Marième est une femme mariée. Elle est mère de trois enfants. Deux de ses enfants fréquentent l'école primaire.Depuis son mariage, elle reste chez elle pour s'occuper, à longueur de journée de ses enfants et des tâches ménagères.Son mari n'ayant plus de les moyens de subvenir seul aux besoins d'entretien de la famille, Marième a commencé un élevage de poulets pour le soutenir. Elle est ainsi parvenu, après un an, à prendre en charge ses propres besoins, à compléter les frais de scolarité des enfants et à améliorer les conditions d'alimentation.Aujourd'hui,elle sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter 300 poussins, des aliments et des produits vétérinaires.  Son ambition est de passer plus tard à l'élevage de moutons.
texts.en:
Marième is a married woman and the mother of three children. Two of the children attend primary school. Since she was married, she has remained at home taking care of herself and her children all day and doing household chores. Since her husband no longer had the means to support the family by himself, Marième started raising hens to support him. Thus, she has managed to support herself after a year, to cover her children's schooling costs, and to improve the food situation. 

Today, Marième is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy 300 chicks, some feed, and veterinary products. Her ambition is to go on to raising sheep.

loans.use: to buy 300 chicks, some feed, and veterinary products

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is 46 years old. Corazon is married and has two children. To make a living, she raises pigs to sell. Corazon has been in her business for 12 years and earns PHP 8,000 a month for these activities. In 2010, Corazon joined GDMPC. Corazon is requesting a new loan of PHP 13,000, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Mi Group

texts.es:
El grupo MI lo conforma tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Petrona del Socorro quien se dedica a la realización de nacatamales, comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo que generalmente vende los viernes, sábados y domingos. Este negocio lo inicio hace 10 años e invertirá el crédito en cerdo, arroz, vegetales, maíz, hoja…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Marina Isabel quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 6 años y María quien elabora y vende nacatamales desde hace 30 años.
texts.en:
The MI group is composed of three hard-working and resourceful people. Petrona del Socorro is one of them, and she engages in preparing “nactamales”, a typical dish made of maize and pork that she generally sells on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. She has been engaged in this activity for 10 years, and she will invest the loan in the purchase of pork, rice, vegetables, maize and bay leaves.
The other members of the group are Marina Isabel, who has been running a corner shop for 6 years, and María, who has been preparing and selling nactamales for 30 years.

loans.use: To buy pork, rice, vegetables, maize and bay leaves.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey is aged 70, a humble farmer and a single parent living in a thatched house located in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children, two of whom are married and have independent lives. Mey has been involved in the farming business for ages to raise her family, and it's the main source of her family's income. She grows and harvests her rice crops for sustenance and sale annually. On average, she is able to earn approximately USD 3 per day.

To continually sustain her business, Mey would like to obtain a loan to purchase farming materials like seeds and fertilizers and pay for operating expenses. This precious loan will contribute to develop her living status and enable her to go on working toward her goal.

loans.use: to purchase farming materials like seeds and fertilizers and pay for operating expenses.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 46-year-old widow who lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For 21 years she has managed her coconut farm business. She earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Rosemarie became a GDMPC member. She has applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

Rosemarie plans to use any profits to expand her business. She is planning to repair her house to create a more conducive place in which to work and live.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia is a 60-year-old resident of Lantungan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She provides for her children's needs from the little amount of PHP 3,000 she makes monthly from her pig business of three years, as an aid to the income her husband makes. This year she became a member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feeding supplies and piglets to raise. Eugenia wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: To buy feeding supplies and piglets to raise

loans.name: Lolomi

texts.en: Lolomi is 36 years old and a single mother with one child. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, salt, soap, etc. She has two years of experience with this business. Lolomi needs a loan to buy more items. She hopes to use her profits to help send her children to school. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her consumers' needs and wants

loans.name: Félix Arnulfo

texts.es:
Félix Arnulfo tiene su propio negocio, el cual consiste en una pequeña talabartería, donde elabora albarda y sus accesorio su negocio está ubicado en el municipio de el sauce, actualmente es un joven con espíritu de superación en la vida cuenta con dos hijos bajo su cargo, el cual tuvo la oportunidad de presentarse nuevamente a Ceprodel con el fin de crecer en su propia actividad, ya que es de su conocimiento que Ceprodel siempre lo ha apoyado en su actividad. 
Por esta razón,  se presentó para solicitar un crédito para la compra de: Baquetón, tiras de suelo, estribos, tejuelo, Acido, Nelina, Mecates y tules, esto será de gran importancia ya que podrá  elaborar más albardas que le será útil  para el crecimiento de su negocio  le permitirá permanecer estable y con buenos ingresos en su hogar.
texts.en:
Félix Arnulfo has his own business, a small saddlery where he makes packsaddles and accessories.  His business is located in the town of El Sauce.  Currently he is a young man with the spirit of improving his life.  He has two children in his care.  He had the opportunity to come again to CEPRODEL with the goal of growing in his own business.  He knows that CEPRODEL always has helped him in his work.

This is why he came to request a loan to buy tanned cowhide, stirrups, acid, rope, tule fiber, and other leather working supplies.  This will be of great importance because he will be able to make more packsaddles, which will be useful to him for the growth of his business.  It will allow him to stay stable and have a good income in his household.

loans.use: to buy tanned cowhide, stirrups, acid, rope, tule fiber, and other leather working supplies.

loans.name: Alsane

texts.fr: Alsane est un jeune qui tient depuis trois ans une alimentation dans son quartier , en face d'un des guichets de l'UIMCEC.Il vend des denrées et produits alimentaires ainsi que des cartes de recharge de crédit téléphone.Sa boutique est en face de la route nationale qui traverse la ville. Cette position très visible lui assure une grande clientèle et des revenus assez consistants.Il participe  aux  dépenses d'entretien de  sa famille et prend entièrement en charge les frais de location de sa boutique ainsi que les factures d'eau et d'électricité.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter du riz, du sucre, de l'huile et d'autres produits alimentaires. Son ambition est d'ouvrir une seconde boutique.
texts.en:
Alsane is a young man who has had a grocery store for three years in his district. It is located opposite one of the UIMCEC branch offices. He sells provisions, as well as phone minutes recharge cards. His store is facing the Route Nationale, which crosses the city. This location is very visible ensuring him a large customer base and fairly sizable revenues. He helps with the costs of caring for his family and is entirely responsible for covering the rental costs of his store, as well as the water and electricity bills. 

To bolster his business capital, he is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other grocery items. His ambition is to open a second store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other grocery items

loans.name: Youba

texts.fr: Youba est un chef de famille qui a en charge son épouse et ses enfants.C'est un boulanger qui exerce ce métier depuis bientôt 10 ans.Avec ses économies, il a commencé la construction de sa maison qui est en phase de finition .Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter du ciment, des carreaux et des portes. Son ambition est de s'engager dans l'embouche bovine.
texts.en: Youba is the head of household who supports his wife and children. He is a baker who has been in this business for nearly ten years. With his savings, he has started building his house and is now in the last phases. He is requesting a  loan of 250,000 francs to buy some cement, paving stones, and doors and gates. His ambition is to become involved in the fattening of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cement, paving stones, and gates and doors.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as blouses, sweaters and skirts for Mother's Day

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng, age 43, an industrious farmer who has been residing together with her husband and four children in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She owns and manages a farming business to generate her income, while her husband goes fishing and sells fish to share his responsibility for this family. Also, Seng has built a wooden pigpen for raising a few piglets for extra income. Despite their hardships of living, they aim to provide a good education to each of their children, so they might have well-paid jobs rather than involving in agricultural businesses, which provides just a decent income for living.

Due to inadequate capital, Seng is asking for a loan of KHR 2,800,000 to purchase maize seed and fertilizers for farming purpose. She hopes to obtain a good harvest through this investment. She thanks in advance for your support and help.

loans.use: to purchase maize seed and fertilizers for farming purpose.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en: Sera is a 27 woman who is married with 3 children. She plans to start a small business, lawn mowing.  Sera needs a loan to purchase new lawn mowing machine. She will use her profits to helps her kids education. Sera joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase new Lawn Mowing Machine

loans.name: Wencerica

texts.en: Wencerica is married, 41 years of age, and lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental together with her 5 kids. Wencerica is operating a general store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and she earns 5,000 every month. She is requesting a loan of 8,650 to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. Wencerica's business is very firm in her community. She joined GDMPC last 2011. In the future, Wencerica will use her income to support her kids in their studies until they finish college and also in their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods for her general store.

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr:
Monsieur Michel habite au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 49 ans et s’active dan le secteur de l’aviculture. Il pratique l’activité d’élevage de poulets de chairs. Il capitalise une expérience d’un an six mois dans son activité qu’il a choisi par nécessité dans le but de subvenir à ses besoins  personnels et faire face aux charges de sa famille.
Monsieur Michel est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2004.Il a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’aliments pour nourrir ses sujets. Son principal objectif est d’améliorer ses revenus et les conditions d’existence  de  vie  au sein de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Michel lives in Sénégal. He is 49 years old and active in the sector of poultry farming. He has a business raising chickens for their meat. He capitalizes on a year and six months of experience in this business, which he chose by necessity with the goal of supporting himself and to cope with family expenses. 

Mr. Michel has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch office since October 2004. He has already repaid a previous loan. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for buying some feed for his livestock. His main goal is to improve his revenues and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock

loans.name: Taupouga

texts.en: Taupouga is 58 years old and married with 6 children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing clothes. She has 4 years of experience in this line of business. Taupouga needs a loan to purchase a new sewing machine. She hopes to use her profits to helps her grandchildren's education. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Crop farming has been the primary source of income for Kan’s family. She has been doing this type of business for almost 17 years with a great support from her spouse. She is 36 years old and married with six children, all whom are under her income and need daily allowances. The shortage of finance in the family encourages Kan to work harder and become flexible in her business to generate a suitable income that can ensure the sustainability of her living.

With the loan she has requested, she would like to pay for the laborers plowing and preparing the land, and buy bean seeds to start growing. She believes that she is able to obtain a fruitful harvest in the coming season through her effort. For her business plan, she intends to rent a few plots of land to expand her production next year.

loans.use: to pay for the laborers plowing and preparing the land, and buy bean seeds to start growing.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is married having 3 children. Marilyn is 24 years old, residing at Carangan, Ozamis City, Philippines. Marilyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. In 2011, Marilyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Marilyn wants to build house and to finished the study of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 50 years old. Regina is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Regina and her husband harvest & sell ocean-caught fish in the local community. Regina has been in her business for 8 years and earns 5,000 a month for these activities. In 2010, Regina joined GDMPC. Regina is requesting a loan of 14,650 which will be used to repair fishing materials used. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair fishing materials

loans.name: Khov

texts.en:
Khov is a resident who has been living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is married to Yim. They have five children, four of whom are already married and live separately and independently around the province. Khov is a local farmer who has been managing farming business for over 30 years. She plants and sells various kinds of crops such as rice, beans, potatoes, maize and vegetables according to each season. 

Khov would like to improve her farm so as to earn more from it. She would like to ensure that she has healthier crops but has inadequate funds now to do so. Therefore she is asking for a loan through HKL to pay for operating expenses of planting her bean crops. Some day, with consistent effort, determination and patience, Khov will achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to pay for operating expenses of planting her bean crops.

loans.name: Valavalaaualii

texts.en:
Valavalaualii is 30 years old and married with 4 children. 
She has a small garden where she grows banana and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Valavalaualii needs a loan to purchase more equipment. 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Valavalaualii will use the profits from her sales to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy more equipment and tools for farming.
